title: The 5th Multidisciplinary Research Conference, Demo Teaching, Global Leaders & Educators Awards, Huwarang Guro, and the Search for Outstanding Authors & Writers Award

content: The 5th Multidisciplinary Research Conference, Demo Teaching, Global Leaders & Educators Awards, Huwarang Guro, and the Search for Outstanding Authors & Writers Award is a prestigious gathering that underscores the value of academic excellence, innovation, and leadership in education and research. Set to take place at the University of the Philippines - Diliman Campus, Quezon City, this significant event serves as a platform for bringing together scholars, educators, and professionals from diverse disciplines . It aims to foster interdisciplinary collaboration and knowledge exchange, providing a venue for the presentation of innovative research findings and best teaching practices. In addition to its academic focus, the event highlights the importance of recognizing exemplary individuals whose contributions in education, research, authorship, and community service have made a global impact. By honoring these outstanding leaders and role models, the conference not only celebrates their accomplishments but also encourages others to pursue excellence and contribute meaningfully to their respective fields and communities.

sections.title: This projects aims:
items: To provide a platform for researchers, educators, and professionals from various disciplines to present and share their research findings and innovative practices.
To promote interdisciplinary collaboration and the exchange of ideas among participants to foster academic and professional growth.

To recognize and honor outstanding individuals in the fields of education, research, authorship, and community service through the Global Leaders & Educators Awards, Huwarang Guro, and Outstanding Authors & Writers Award.

sections.title: Contributions to the Sustainable Development Goals
content: The 5th Multidisciplinary Research Conference, Demo Teaching, Global Leaders & Educators Awards, Huwarang Guro, and Search for Outstanding Authors & Writers Award make meaningful contributions to several United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). Primarily, it advances SDG 4: Quality Education by promoting academic excellence, showcasing innovative teaching methods, and encouraging lifelong learning and professional growth among educators and researchers. Through its emphasis on interdisciplinary collaboration and the presentation of impactful research, the event also supports SDG 9: Industry, Innovation, and Infrastructure , as it encourages the development of innovative solutions to real-world challenges. By honoring individuals who have shown exceptional leadership and service in education and research, it reinforces the principles of SDG 16: Peace, Justice, and Strong Institutions , promoting transparency, accountability, and ethical leadership. Additionally, the conference fosters international collaboration and inclusivity, thereby contributing to SDG 17: Partnerships for the Goals , as it brings together professionals from diverse disciplines and sectors to work collectively toward sustainable and transformative development.

columns.title: General Assessment
content: The 5th Multidisciplinary Research Conference, Demo Teaching, Global Leaders & Educators Awards, Huwarang Guro, and Search for Outstanding Authors & Writers Award was a highly impactful and well-organized event that successfully met its objectives. It provided a dynamic and inclusive platform for scholars, educators, and professionals from various disciplines to share their research, teaching practices, and intellectual contributions. The diverse range of topics and the interdisciplinary nature of the presentations enriched the academic experience of all participants, encouraging collaboration and the cross-pollination of ideas. The demo teaching sessions were particularly commendable for offering practical, innovative, and learner-centered strategies that educators could apply in their respective institutions.

Furthermore, the recognition of outstanding individuals through the awards ceremonies added a meaningful dimension to the event, highlighting the importance of leadership, excellence, and service in the fields of education, research, and writing. These recognitions served not only to honor accomplishments but also to inspire others toward higher standards of professional and academic excellence. Overall, the conference was a successful convergence of intellect, creativity, and dedication, making a significant contribution to the advancement of education and research both locally and globally.

columns.title: Recommendations
content: To further enhance the impact and reach of future iterations of the Multidisciplinary Research Conference and associated award programs, it is recommended to integrate more interactive and collaborative sessions such as workshops, roundtable discussions, and interdisciplinary research forums. These formats can deepen participant engagement and foster stronger connections among attendees from different fields. Additionally, incorporating virtual participation options could widen accessibility and global involvement, especially for international scholars and educators who may not be able to attend in person. It is also advisable to establish follow-up mechanisms, such as publication opportunities or collaborative research networks, to sustain the momentum and academic partnerships formed during the event. Finally, creating feedback systems from participants can help organizers continuously improve the quality, relevance, and inclusivity of the conference and its activities.

title: Advancing Quality Education and Institutional Excellence through SDG-Aligned Benchmarking: A Strategic Visit to Adamson University

content: Benchmarking is a key mechanism for gauging the effectiveness of our academic and administrative systems against sector leaders. Adamson University, recognized for its innovative curricula, research productivity, and streamlined operations, offers a relevant reference point for peer learning. With this context, a multidisciplinary delegation visited Adamson University to study its best practices first-hand. The goal was to capture transferable models—particularly in outcome-based education, industry-aligned research, and data-driven governance—that can accelerate our own quality-assurance and strategic-planning efforts.

sections.title: This projects aims:
items: Review Adamson University’s curriculum design and outcome-based assessment strategies.
Examine research-support structures, grant acquisition processes, and publication incentives.
Observe administrative workflows, digital platforms, and quality-assurance mechanisms that improve efficiency.
Identify opportunities for faculty and student exchanges, joint research, and shared professional development.
Gather actionable insights to inform revisions of our institutional policies and strategic roadmap.

sections.title: Contributions to the Sustainable Development Goals
content: The visit directly advances SDG 4 (Quality Education) by integrating proven pedagogical and research practices into our programs, and SDG 17 (Partnerships for the Goals) by opening channels for sustained collaboration with Adamson University. Strengthened governance and transparency frameworks identified during the visit further support SDG 16 (Peace, Justice & Strong Institutions), ensuring our systems remain accountable and resilient.

columns.title: General Assessment
content: Participants rated the benchmarking exercise highly effective, citing Adamson’s cohesive alignment of academic, research, and administrative functions as a standout feature. Key takeaways include robust outcome-based assessment rubrics, centralized research-grant facilitation, and agile governance structures that enable rapid curricular adjustments.

The delegation also noted Adamson’s success in fostering an innovation culture through maker spaces and industry-funded research hubs. These facilities not only enhance student learning but also drive faculty engagement in applied research, offering a replicable model for our context.

Overall, the visit validated many of our ongoing reforms while revealing practical enhancements—especially in digital learning analytics and integrated quality-assurance systems—that can accelerate our drive toward institutional excellence.

columns.title: Recommendations
content: We should adapt Adamson University’s outcome-based curriculum audit process, tailoring its performance indicators to our program objectives and accreditation requirements. Establishing a cross-functional task force will ensure coherent implementation, timely feedback loops, and faculty buy-in. Simultaneously, piloting a centralized research-support unit—mirroring Adamson’s grant facilitation office—can streamline proposal development, boost external funding success, and create a unified database for monitoring research outputs, thereby embedding a culture of continuous improvement aligned with the Sustainable Development Goals.

title: Association of Data and Educational Systems Support Administrators (ADESSA) Local Resource Assembly (LRA) 2024

content: In May 2024, Urdaneta City University actively participated in the Association of Data and Educational Systems Support Administrators (ADESSA) Local Resource Assembly (LRA) 2024, showcasing its dedication to educational innovation, digital transformation, and institutional capacity building. This assembly brought together information systems professionals, education technology leaders, and institutional administrators from across the region to collaborate on improving data management systems and advancing digital tools for education. UCU's involvement in the ADESSA LRA aligns with its long-term goal of becoming a tech-forward institution capable of adapting to the rapidly evolving landscape of education and governance.

By participating in this national gathering, UCU aimed to deepen its understanding of best practices in education data systems, learn about the latest developments in IT solutions, and strengthen its internal systems for academic and administrative efficiency. The activity provided a valuable platform for networking, knowledge exchange, and collaborative planning between institutions and education system providers. UCU’s engagement in the ADESSA LRA 2024 reflects its strategic vision to continuously modernize its infrastructure, promote digital literacy, and ensure that technological innovations contribute meaningfully to student success and institutional growth.

sections.title: This projects aims:
items: To enhance institutional knowledge and capabilities in educational data systems and digital infrastructure through exposure to the latest trends, tools, and technologies presented at the assembly.
To promote collaboration and networking with other educational institutions, IT professionals, and system providers for the improvement of academic and administrative services.
To support the university’s digital transformation goals by identifying innovative solutions that can streamline operations, improve data accuracy, and support evidence-based decision-making.

To align institutional practices with national and global standards in education technology, ensuring that UCU remains competitive and future-ready in delivering quality education through efficient systems.

sections.title: Contributions to the Sustainable Development Goals
content: Urdaneta City University’s involvement in the ADESSA LRA 2024 contributes directly to SDG 4: Quality Education by enhancing its capacity to adopt and implement data-driven systems that improve educational delivery and outcomes. Through exposure to innovative technologies and digital tools, the university strengthens its institutional ability to provide accurate, accessible, and responsive academic services to students and faculty. These improvements lead to better learning experiences, efficient resource management, and more inclusive access to education.

Furthermore, this activity supports SDG 9: Industry, Innovation, and Infrastructure by promoting the integration of advanced IT solutions into the university’s operations. Strengthening digital infrastructure helps modernize processes such as enrollment, records management, and student support services—laying the groundwork for a more innovative and future-ready academic institution.

Lastly, the assembly contributes to SDG 17: Partnerships for the Goals, as UCU builds linkages with other academic institutions, government agencies, and private system providers. These collaborations foster knowledge exchange and shared best practices, helping institutions work together to advance educational technology and sustainable development on a broader scale.

columns.title: General Assessment
content: Urdaneta City University's participation in the ADESSA LRA 2024 was a timely and strategic move that reflects its proactive approach to institutional modernization. The activity provided valuable insights into the current trends in educational technology and system integration, equipping university representatives with the knowledge needed to upgrade existing processes and improve service delivery. The exposure to various digital solutions and system providers also broadened UCU's perspective on how to better manage academic and administrative data in a secure, efficient, and user-friendly manner.

The assembly served as an excellent platform for professional development, particularly for the university’s IT and administrative staff, who play critical roles in implementing digital tools and managing institutional systems. The collaborative and solution-oriented nature of the event fostered meaningful discussions and practical learning, allowing participants to engage with experts, raise concerns, and seek advice on challenges they face within their respective institutions. This exchange of ideas added depth and value to the experience, going beyond mere product demonstrations.

Overall, the activity can be considered highly successful and impactful. It reinforced UCU’s commitment to data accuracy, operational efficiency, and digital transformation in higher education. The university’s engagement in such assemblies ensures that it remains responsive to technological advancements and capable of sustaining innovations that benefit its students, faculty, and the larger academic community.

columns.title: Recommendations
content: To maximize the long-term benefits of participating in the ADESSA LRA, it is recommended that Urdaneta City University form a dedicated digital transformation task force responsible for assessing, planning, and implementing technology solutions discussed during the assembly. This group should evaluate which systems are most compatible with UCU’s current infrastructure, pilot new technologies, and lead campus-wide IT training to ensure smooth integration. Institutionalizing follow-through efforts after such events will ensure that learnings are translated into actionable improvements, rather than remaining theoretical insights.

Additionally, the university should consider organizing internal echo sessions or knowledge-sharing forums, where attendees of the ADESSA LRA can present key takeaways and proposed innovations to other departments. This approach will not only expand the reach of the knowledge gained but will also foster a culture of collaboration and continuous learning across the university. Moving forward, regular participation in similar assemblies and maintaining strong partnerships with technology providers will be crucial for keeping UCU at the forefront of education technology and institutional efficiency.

title: Empowering Inclusive Professional Development for Sustainable Communities: The Alaminos IPD Seminar

content: The Alaminos IPD Seminar convened educators, industry experts, and community leaders with the shared goal of enhancing professional skills and knowledge in their respective fields. This event provided a valuable platform for exchanging ideas, discussing emerging trends, and exploring innovative practices relevant to inclusive professional development. By bringing together diverse stakeholders, the seminar aimed to foster collaboration and strengthen the capacity of participants to contribute effectively to their communities and industries. The gathering underscored the importance of continuous learning and professional growth in driving sustainable development and community advancement.

sections.title: This projects aims:
items: To enhance the professional skills and knowledge of educators, industry experts, and community leaders.
To provide a platform for sharing best practices and innovative approaches in inclusive professional development.
To foster collaboration and networking among diverse stakeholders for community and industry advancement.
To discuss emerging trends and challenges relevant to professional growth and inclusive development.

sections.title: Contributions to the Sustainable Development Goals
content: The Alaminos IPD Seminar contributes to the achievement of several Sustainable Development Goals by promoting inclusive and equitable quality education (SDG 4) through skill enhancement and knowledge sharing among educators, industry professionals, and community leaders. By fostering collaboration and networking, the seminar supports partnerships for the goals (SDG 17), encouraging collective action toward sustainable development. Additionally, the focus on inclusive professional development aids in reducing inequalities (SDG 10) and promotes sustainable economic growth (SDG 8) by equipping participants with the competencies needed to drive innovation and community progress.

columns.title: General Assessment
content: The Alaminos IPD Seminar was a successful event that effectively brought together diverse stakeholders, including educators, industry professionals, and community leaders, to focus on enhancing professional development. The seminar facilitated meaningful exchanges of knowledge and best practices, fostering a collaborative environment conducive to learning and innovation. Participants expressed appreciation for the relevance of the topics discussed and the practical applications presented. Overall, the seminar contributed positively to building the capacity of attendees, strengthening partnerships, and advancing inclusive and sustainable development goals within the community.

columns.title: Recommendations
content: To build on the success of the Alaminos IPD Seminar, it is recommended to organize regular follow-up sessions and workshops to deepen the knowledge and skills gained. Enhancing participant engagement through interactive activities and case studies can improve learning outcomes. Expanding outreach to include more diverse sectors and community members will foster broader collaboration. Additionally, establishing mechanisms for monitoring and evaluating the impact of the seminar will help in refining future programs and ensuring alignment with sustainable development goals.

title: ATQA WEBINAR ON TEACHER QUALITY ASSURANCE

content: To build on the success of the Alaminos IPD Seminar, it is recommended to organize regular follow-up sessions and workshops to deepen the knowledge and skills gained. Enhancing participant engagement through interactive activities and case studies can improve learning outcomes. Expanding outreach to include more diverse sectors and community members will foster broader collaboration. Additionally, establishing mechanisms for monitoring and evaluating the impact of the seminar will help in refining future programs and ensuring alignment with sustainable development goals. The ATQA (Asian Teacher Quality Assurance) webinar was conceived in response to the growing demand for educational systems across Asia to enhance teacher quality and effectiveness amidst rapid societal, technological, and policy changes. As education remains a cornerstone for national development, the role of teachers in delivering high-quality learning experiences has never been more critical. Many educational institutions are currently facing challenges related to maintaining teaching standards, adapting to diverse learning needs, and implementing effective quality assurance mechanisms. Recognizing these challenges, the ATQA webinar sought to provide a platform for stakeholders—including educators, administrators, and quality assurance experts—to share knowledge, best practices, and innovations. The event also aimed to promote alignment with international standards and foster a regional culture of continuous improvement and excellence in teaching. This initiative underscores the belief that effective teachers are central to educational success, and that sustained professional development and institutional support are essential in empowering them to meet the demands of 21st-century learning.

sections.title: This projects aims:
items: To enhance understanding of teacher quality assurance by introducing evidence-based practices and globally recognized frameworks.
To foster collaboration among institutions across Asia by creating a shared platform for dialogue, experience-sharing, and peer learning.
To encourage critical thinking and problem-solving around current challenges in teacher development, leading to scalable and context-appropriate solutions.
To influence education policy and practice by providing an informative and transformative experience that drives change at various levels of the education sector.

sections.title: Contributions to the Sustainable Development Goals
content: The ATQA webinar significantly contributes to the achievement of the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals, particularly SDG 4: Quality Education. By focusing on improving teacher effectiveness and supporting continuous professional development, the webinar directly supports the target of increasing the supply of qualified teachers and enhancing learning outcomes. High-quality teaching is a fundamental requirement for ensuring inclusive and equitable education, and the strategies shared during the webinar emphasized the importance of pedagogical innovation, cultural responsiveness, and student-centered approaches. In addition, the event aligns with SDG 17: Partnerships for the Goals, by fostering collaboration and knowledge exchange among educators, institutions, and policy-makers across different countries. This collective effort strengthens the regional education ecosystem and builds a foundation for long-term, sustainable improvements in teaching and learning.

columns.title: General Assessment
content: The overall assessment of the ATQA webinar is overwhelmingly positive. Participants reported high levels of satisfaction with the content, organization, and relevance of the sessions. The event successfully bridged theoretical knowledge with practical application, making it highly valuable for both frontline educators and institutional leaders. Feedback indicated that the sessions were thought-provoking, well-structured, and rich in actionable insights. Many attendees noted that the discussions encouraged them to reassess existing practices within their institutions and inspired them to pursue new strategies for teacher development and quality assurance. Moreover, the diversity of perspectives—from academic researchers to classroom practitioners—added depth and richness to the discussions. The collaborative atmosphere of the webinar fostered mutual learning and a sense of shared commitment to advancing teaching standards across the region.

columns.title: Recommendations
content: The overall assessment of the ATQA webinar is overwhelmingly positive. Participants reported high levels of satisfaction with the content, organization, and relevance of the sessions. The event successfully bridged theoretical knowledge with practical application, making it highly valuable for both frontline educators and institutional leaders. Feedback indicated that the sessions were thought-provoking, well-structured, and rich in actionable insights. Many attendees noted that the discussions encouraged them to reassess existing practices within their institutions and inspired them to pursue new strategies for teacher development and quality assurance. Moreover, the diversity of perspectives—from academic researchers to classroom practitioners—added depth and richness to the discussions. The collaborative atmosphere of the webinar fostered mutual learning and a sense of shared commitment to advancing teaching standards across the region.

The Career Orientation for 2024 Graduating Students of Urdaneta City University is a strategic initiative aimed at preparing soon-to-be graduates for the transition from academic life to the professional world. As the job market becomes increasingly competitive and dynamic, it is crucial that students are equipped not only with academic knowledge but also with practical skills and insights relevant to their chosen career paths. This orientation program is designed to provide graduating students with essential tools such as career planning strategies, resume writing techniques, and interview preparation tips.

It also aims to raise awareness about current job market trends and expectations from employers across different industries. Key components of the event include expert-led seminars, alumni success stories, industry talks, and networking opportunities. Through this orientation, Urdaneta City University reaffirms its commitment to holistic student development by supporting its graduates in their journey toward meaningful and successful careers.

sections.title: This projects aims:
items: To prepare graduating students for employment by equipping them with essential career planning tools, such as resume writing, interview techniques, and job search strategies.
To increase awareness of current job market trends and help students understand employer expectations in various industries.
To provide opportunities for networking with industry professionals, alumni, and career counselors who can offer guidance and support.
To build students’ confidence and readiness in transitioning from academic life to the professional world.

sections.title: Contributions to the Sustainable Development Goals
content: This career orientation activity contributes significantly to SDG 4: Quality Education by ensuring that students not only receive academic instruction but also gain access to relevant career guidance and employability skills. By integrating career readiness programs into the university experience, the activity helps bridge the gap between education and employment, enhancing the overall quality and relevance of higher education. It promotes lifelong learning and prepares students to become productive members of society.

The event also supports SDG 8: Decent Work and Economic Growth by empowering students with the tools and knowledge needed to enter the workforce with confidence and competence. Through sessions on job market trends, resume writing, and interview preparation, the program increases students’ chances of securing meaningful employment. Furthermore, by connecting students with industry professionals and successful alumni, the orientation fosters opportunities for internships, mentorships, and long-term career growth, all of which contribute to inclusive and sustainable economic development.

Lastly, the activity aligns with SDG 17: Partnerships for the Goals by encouraging collaboration between the university, industries, and alumni. These partnerships enhance the learning experience and provide students with a support network that extends beyond graduation. By working together to prepare the next generation of professionals, all stakeholders contribute to the collective goal of building a more educated, skilled, and sustainable workforce ready to address the global challenges of today and tomorrow.

columns.title: General Assessment
content: The Career Orientation for 2024 Graduating Students proved to be a well-organized and impactful initiative by Urdaneta City University. The program successfully addressed the needs of graduating students by providing them with essential knowledge and practical tools for transitioning into the workforce. The combination of expert talks, alumni sharing, and interactive workshops created a well-rounded learning environment. Students were able to gain a clearer understanding of the job market, industry expectations, and how to position themselves effectively for employment.

One of the strongest aspects of the orientation was its focus on engagement and real-world relevance. The presence of professionals from different industries and successful alumni made the sessions more relatable and credible. Resume-building and interview workshops were particularly helpful, as they offered hands-on experience and immediate feedback. The networking opportunities allowed students to establish connections that could potentially lead to job or internship offers, further enhancing the event's value.

Overall, the activity met its objectives and was well-received by the student participants. It contributed not only to their career readiness but also to their personal growth and confidence. The orientation reaffirmed the university’s commitment to producing graduates who are not only academically competent but also prepared for the professional world. It is recommended that this activity be continued and expanded in future years to include follow-up sessions and more industry partnerships to further support students' career development.

columns.title: Recommendations
content: To further enhance the impact of the career orientation program, it is recommended that follow-up sessions or career clinics be organized throughout the academic year. These sessions can provide more in-depth training on job application processes, such as mock interviews, portfolio development, and job-hunting strategies tailored to specific fields. Additionally, integrating digital tools like LinkedIn profile building and online job platforms into the orientation can better prepare students for the modern job market. Offering one-on-one consultations with career counselors would also allow for personalized guidance based on individual goals and needs.

It is also recommended to strengthen partnerships with local industries, companies, and alumni networks to expand opportunities for internships, mentorships, and on-the-spot job offers. Inviting a more diverse set of speakers from various career paths — including entrepreneurship, public service, and international employment — can help students explore a wider range of career options. Finally, gathering formal feedback from participants after the event can provide valuable insights that will help organizers refine the program for future graduating batches.

In recognition of the vital role that human rights play within the criminal justice system, the College of Criminal Justice Education, in collaboration with the Commission on Human Rights (CHR) Region 1, is organizing a seminar to delve into pressing issues at the nexus of criminal justice and human rights. This initiative arises from the growing need to equip future justice professionals and stakeholders with a comprehensive understanding of legal principles, ethical responsibilities, and the human rights implications of criminal justice policies and practices.

Amid ongoing societal challenges and reforms, this seminar seeks to foster a deeper appreciation of human dignity, legal safeguards, and institutional accountability. It will serve as a platform for dialogue, knowledge sharing, and capacity building through expert presentations, panel discussions, and interactive activities. By bringing together students, educators, professionals, and human rights advocates, the event aims to inspire collaborative efforts toward a more just, equitable, and humane justice system within the region.Through this undertaking, the organizing bodies reaffirm their shared commitment to promoting justice and human rights, empowering participants to become agents of positive change in their respective communities.

sections.title: This projects aims:
items: To enhance awareness of fundamental human rights principles and their relevance to criminal justice practices.
To promote critical discussions on existing issues, policies, and reforms affecting justice and human rights in the region.
To equip participants with knowledge and tools to advocate for human rights based approaches in criminal justice settings.
To foster collaboration among students, educators, professionals, and human rights advocates to address societal concerns through informed and ethical practices.

sections.title: Contributions to the Sustainable Development Goals
content: This seminar contributes significantly to the advancement of the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs), particularly in the areas of education, equality, justice, and partnership. By fostering a deeper understanding of human rights and the criminal justice system, it supports SDG 4: Quality Education, as it provides participants with valuable learning opportunities through expert-led discussions and interactive sessions. The focus on addressing systemic issues and protecting the rights of marginalized groups aligns with SDG 10: Reduced Inequalities, promoting inclusion and equal treatment under the law. Central to the seminar's theme is SDG 16: Peace, Justice, and Strong Institutions, as it emphasizes the importance of rule of law, accountability, and the protection of fundamental freedoms. Furthermore, the collaboration between the College of Criminal Justice Education and the Commission on Human Rights Region 1 exemplifies SDG 17: Partnerships for the Goals, showcasing the power of inter-institutional cooperation in tackling complex societal challenges. Through these contributions, the seminar not only enhances knowledge and awareness but also reinforces a shared commitment to sustainable, just, and inclusive development.

columns.title: General Assessment
content: The seminar conducted in partnership with the College of Criminal Justice Education and the Commission on Human Rights (CHR) Region 1 was a meaningful and impactful initiative that successfully met its objectives. It provided a comprehensive platform for participants to engage in thought-provoking discussions on the intersection of criminal justice and human rights. The expert presentations, interactive sessions, and open forums enabled a productive exchange of knowledge and ideas, enhancing the participants’ understanding of legal frameworks, human rights protections, and the need for systemic reform.

The active involvement of students, educators, professionals, and human rights advocates fostered a collaborative learning environment that emphasized the importance of advocacy, ethical practice, and social responsibility. The seminar not only raised awareness about pressing societal issues but also inspired participants to contribute toward the promotion of justice, equality, and human dignity within their communities.

Overall, the activity was well-organized and effectively aligned with broader educational and social goals, including the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). It demonstrated the power of academic and institutional partnerships in addressing real-world challenges and empowering future leaders in the field of criminal justice and human rights.

columns.title: Recommendations
content: We are pleased to announce the upcoming seminar hosted in collaboration with the College of Criminal Justice Education and the Commission on Human Rights (CHR) Region 1. This important event will explore pressing issues at the intersection of criminal justice and human rights, with a particular focus on the unique challenges and opportunities within our region. Participants can look forward to expert presentations, thought-provoking panel discussions, and interactive sessions designed to deepen understanding and inspire meaningful dialogue. Key topics will include legal frameworks, human rights protections in law enforcement and correctional systems, and approaches to effective criminal justice reform. Through this seminar, we reaffirm our shared commitment to justice, equality, and human rights. We invite students, professionals, and community members to join us in advancing awareness and collaborative action toward a more just and humane society.

title: Fostering Educational Excellence and Collaboration at Cebu Normal University

content: The visit to Cebu Normal University provided an opportunity to engage closely with faculty members, students, and administrative staff, fostering meaningful dialogue on educational methodologies and institutional practices. During the visit, interactive sessions and campus tours offered firsthand insight into the university’s vibrant learning environment and its strong commitment to academic excellence and innovation. This engagement highlighted the dedication of the university community to nurturing a culture of knowledge, growth, and continuous improvement. The experience not only broadened perspectives on effective educational strategies but also opened doors for potential future collaborations aimed at enhancing academic and institutional development.

sections.title: This projects aims:
items: To engage with faculty, students, and administrative staff for meaningful discussions on educational methodologies and institutional practices.
To observe and assess the university’s learning environment, facilities, and academic programs through campus tours.
To explore opportunities for academic collaboration and partnership between institutions.
To gain insights into innovative teaching strategies and best practices in higher education

sections.title: Contributions to the Sustainable Development Goals
content: The visit to Cebu Normal University contributes to several Sustainable Development Goals by promoting quality education (SDG 4) through the exchange of innovative teaching methodologies and best practices. By engaging faculty and students in meaningful discussions and interactive sessions, the activity supports inclusive and equitable learning opportunities. The emphasis on academic excellence and institutional growth aligns with SDG 9 (Industry, Innovation, and Infrastructure) by fostering innovation in educational approaches. Furthermore, the visit encourages partnerships and collaboration, reinforcing SDG 17 (Partnerships for the Goals), which is essential for achieving sustainable development through collective efforts.

columns.title: General Assessment
content: The visit to Cebu Normal University was a highly valuable experience that provided deep insights into the institution’s dedication to academic excellence and innovation. The engagement with faculty, students, and administrative staff revealed a strong culture of collaboration and commitment to continuous improvement in educational practices. The interactive sessions and campus tours highlighted the university’s vibrant learning environment and robust support systems for students and staff. Overall, the visit affirmed Cebu Normal University’s position as a forward-thinking institution and opened promising avenues for future academic partnerships and knowledge exchange.

columns.title: Recommendations
content: To build on the positive outcomes of the visit to Cebu Normal University, it is recommended to establish formal channels for ongoing collaboration, such as joint research projects, faculty exchanges, and student programs. Encouraging regular dialogue will facilitate the sharing of best practices and innovative teaching methodologies. Additionally, both institutions should explore opportunities to co-develop academic programs that address emerging educational needs. Strengthening communication and partnership frameworks will help sustain mutual growth and contribute to advancing quality education and institutional development.

title: CERTIFY THAT URDANETA CITY UNIVERSITY IS REGISTERED MEMBER OF GLOBAL SCHOOL ALLIANCE

content: Urdaneta City University has been officially recognized as a registered member of the Global School Alliance, an esteemed international network of educational institutions dedicated to promoting global collaboration, academic excellence, and cultural exchange. This certification signifies the university’s commitment to enhancing the quality of education through active participation in initiatives that foster innovation, research, and cross-cultural understanding. As part of this alliance, Urdaneta City University gains access to a platform for sharing best practices, engaging in collaborative projects, and preparing its students to succeed in an increasingly interconnected world. This milestone reflects the university’s strategic focus on internationalization and its dedication to contributing to global educational development.

sections.title: This projects aims:
items: Enhance educational quality by participating in global initiatives and adopting best practices shared within the international network.
Promote cultural exchange to foster global awareness, understanding, and collaboration among students and faculty.
Engage in innovative research projects that contribute to academic development and address global challenges.
Expand academic and professional networks through partnerships with other member institutions worldwide.

sections.title: Contributions to the Sustainable Development Goals
content: Urdaneta City University’s membership in the Global School Alliance significantly contributes to several Sustainable Development Goals. By enhancing educational quality and promoting inclusive and equitable education, the activity supports SDG 4 (Quality Education). The cultural exchange programs fostered through this network encourage mutual understanding and respect among diverse communities, advancing SDG 16 (Peace, Justice, and Strong Institutions). Engagement in innovative research projects contributes to SDG 9 (Industry, Innovation, and Infrastructure) by supporting scientific progress and knowledge sharing. Furthermore, the global partnerships align with SDG 17 (Partnerships for the Goals), emphasizing the importance of collaboration to achieve sustainable development. Together, these contributions help prepare students with the skills and global perspectives necessary to address complex societal challenges and promote sustainable growth.

columns.title: General Assessment
content: Urdaneta City University’s membership in the Global School Alliance represents a significant advancement in its efforts to internationalize education and enhance academic quality. This affiliation has effectively opened avenues for collaboration, cultural exchange, and research innovation, enriching the learning environment for both students and faculty. By connecting with a diverse network of global institutions, the university has strengthened its capacity to adopt best practices and stay abreast of emerging educational trends. The partnership has contributed positively to the university’s reputation as a forward-thinking institution committed to preparing students for success in a globalized world. Overall, this membership underscores the university’s dedication to fostering excellence, inclusivity, and sustainability in education.

columns.title: Recommendations
content: To maximize the benefits of Urdaneta City University’s membership in the Global School Alliance, it is recommended to actively engage in collaborative projects and knowledge-sharing activities with other member institutions. The university should encourage faculty and students to participate in international programs, cultural exchanges, and joint research initiatives to enhance global competencies. Strengthening internal capacities through training and workshops can further prepare stakeholders to leverage opportunities within the alliance. Additionally, promoting awareness of this membership among students, staff, and the community will foster greater participation and support. Finally, regularly evaluating the impact of the membership will help identify areas for improvement and ensure alignment with the university’s strategic goals and the Sustainable Development Goals.

Urdaneta City University (UCU) is scaling up its industry linkages to give students hands-on exposure to emerging technologies and global work cultures. Partnering with international firms is central to this agenda, particularly in engineering, information technology, and business programs where real-world application accelerates learning. Easycom-Japan, a technology solutions provider known for enterprise software, IoT integration, and talent-development programs, offers a potent match for UCU’s goals. Signing a Memorandum of Agreement (MoA) formalizes cooperation on internships, technology-transfer initiatives, and collaborative projects—positioning both institutions to co-create value and expand their international footprints.

sections.title: This projects aims:
items: Establish a structured internship pipeline that places qualified UCU students in Easycom-Japan’s Philippine and Japanese operations.
Launch joint technology-transfer and capstone projects that apply Easycom’s platforms to local community or industry needs.
Facilitate faculty upskilling through short residencies, technical workshops, and collaborative research with Easycom engineers.

sections.title: Contributions to the Sustainable Development Goals
content: The partnership advances SDG 4 (Quality Education) by enriching curricula with industry-aligned competencies, SDG 8 (Decent Work & Economic Growth) through skills development and employability pathways, and SDG 9 (Industry, Innovation & Infrastructure) by fostering technology diffusion and problem-solving projects that address local development challenges. The cross-border collaboration also exemplifies SDG 17 (Partnerships for the Goals), demonstrating how academia and industry can jointly drive sustainable innovation.

columns.title: General Assessment
content: Urdaneta City University’s membership in the Global School Alliance represents a significant advancement in its efforts to internationalize education and enhance academic quality. This affiliation has effectively opened avenues for collaboration, cultural exchange, and research innovation, enriching the learning environment for both students and faculty. By connecting with a diverse network of global institutions, the university has strengthened its capacity to adopt best practices and stay abreast of emerging educational trends. The partnership has contributed positively to the university’s reputation as a forward-thinking institution committed to preparing students for success in a globalized world. Overall, this membership underscores the university’s dedication to fostering excellence, inclusivity, and sustainability in education.

columns.title: Recommendations
content: To maximize the benefits of Urdaneta City University’s membership in the Global School Alliance, it is recommended to actively engage in collaborative projects and knowledge-sharing activities with other member institutions. The university should encourage faculty and students to participate in international programs, cultural exchanges, and joint research initiatives to enhance global competencies. Strengthening internal capacities through training and workshops can further prepare stakeholders to leverage opportunities within the alliance. Additionally, promoting awareness of this membership among students, staff, and the community will foster greater participation and support. Finally, regularly evaluating the impact of the membership will help identify areas for improvement and ensure alignment with the university’s strategic goals and the Sustainable Development Goals.

title: GLOBAL RESKILLING MOVEMENT WEBINAR AND PARTNERSHIP

content: The Global Reskilling Movement Webinar and Partnership was organized in alignment with our university’s goal to foster innovation, enhance employability, and support sustainable economic growth. Through this initiative, students gain free one-year access to ReSkills (www.reskills.com), a global online learning platform known for delivering high-quality, live daily classes focused on relevant 21st-century skills. The partnership recognizes the growing need for adaptable learning systems that empower students and professionals to remain competitive in an ever-evolving labor market.

ReSkills focuses on three critical learning categories: Professional Growth, Career Development, and Entrepreneurship. These areas are designed to equip learners with practical and in-demand skills needed to thrive in the digital and knowledge-driven economy. As classes are conducted via Zoom, the platform enables accessibility regardless of geographical location—ensuring that students, even from remote areas, can take advantage of globally recognized certifications and transformative learning experiences.

sections.title: This projects aims:
items: To provide students with free access to quality, globally accredited online learning resources.
To enhance students’ career readiness, entrepreneurial skills, and professional development through continuous learning.
To promote inclusivity and equitable access to digital learning regardless of location.

sections.title: Contributions to the Sustainable Development Goals
content: The Global Reskilling Movement directly supports SDG 4: Quality Education by democratizing access to world-class education through a digital platform. It also contributes to SDG 8: Decent Work and Economic Growth by equipping learners with employable and entrepreneurial skills aligned with current job market demands. Moreover, by bridging digital divides and ensuring equal opportunities, this initiative aligns with SDG 10: Reduced Inequalities, especially in educational access among rural and underserved communities.

columns.title: General Assessment
content: The webinar and partnership launch was a resounding success, generating excitement and high levels of engagement among students and faculty alike. The platform's ease of use, combined with its diverse offerings and daily live sessions, received positive feedback for its capacity to supplement traditional learning with practical, career-oriented knowledge. The one-year free access to ReSkills is seen as a significant opportunity, especially for students from resource-limited areas.

Participants appreciated the globally accredited certification system that accompanies course completion, giving them a competitive advantage in job applications, internships, or entrepreneurial ventures. The digital-first approach was especially well-suited to current educational trends that favor flexibility, interactivity, and self-paced learning.

Overall, the activity has made a strong initial impact. With continued promotion and user support, it holds the potential to transform how students and educators engage with skill-based learning. The commitment to innovation, accessibility, and relevance in education makes this initiative a valuable asset in our academic landscape.

columns.title: Recommendations
content: To sustain the momentum of this initiative, it is recommended that the university establish a ReSkills Support and Monitoring Team tasked with promoting platform usage, tracking student progress, and resolving technical or academic concerns. Faculty should also be encouraged to integrate ReSkills classes into their syllabi where appropriate, reinforcing learning outcomes through applied, industry-relevant content.

Additionally, a series of follow-up webinars or user experience sharing sessions should be held to maintain engagement and help learners reflect on their growth. By embedding this platform into the fabric of our academic support system, the university can ensure that the full benefits of the Global Reskilling Movement are realized across all departments and stakeholders.

In May 2024, Urdaneta City University participated in the International Education Fair (IEF) Oman 2024, a prestigious event that brought together educational institutions, global stakeholders, and prospective students from various countries. This international fair served as a platform for promoting academic exchange, cross-border partnerships, and higher education opportunities. UCU’s participation highlighted its commitment to internationalization and its desire to expand its global reach through strategic collaborations. Through IEF Oman 2024, UCU showcased its academic programs, research initiatives, and institutional values to a diverse international audience.

The event provided an avenue for the university to connect with educational agencies, student recruiters, and potential partner institutions across the Middle East and beyond. It also allowed UCU to explore opportunities for international student enrollment, research collaboration, and faculty development programs. This initiative aligns with UCU’s vision of becoming a globally recognized institution of higher learning. By engaging in global education fairs like IEF Oman, UCU strengthens its identity as an inclusive, forward-looking university that values cross-cultural exchange and international cooperation in education and research.

sections.title: This projects aims:
items: To promote UCU’s academic programs and institutional strengths to a global audience, attracting international students and academic partners.
To establish linkages with international universities, education agencies, and stakeholders for potential collaborations in research, faculty exchange, and academic development.
To explore global trends and best practices in higher education that can be adapted and applied to improve UCU’s academic standards and international competitiveness.

sections.title: Contributions to the Sustainable Development Goals
content: Urdaneta City University’s participation in the IEF Oman 2024 contributes significantly to several Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs), particularly SDG 4: Quality Education and SDG 17: Partnerships for the Goals. By presenting its academic offerings and engaging with international institutions, UCU promotes access to inclusive and equitable quality education while enhancing global learning opportunities. This fosters academic exchange, cultural understanding, and mutual learning, which are essential elements of a globally relevant and inclusive education system.

Furthermore, the activity supports SDG 17 by building strong international partnerships that encourage cooperation in research, faculty development, and student mobility. These cross-border collaborations help strengthen institutional capacity, broaden educational access, and contribute to the shared global goal of sustainable, inclusive development in higher education. The event also indirectly aligns with SDG 8: Decent Work and Economic Growth, by creating pathways for international education that can lead to better employment opportunities for graduates, both locally and abroad.

By participating in global education platforms such as IEF Oman, UCU reinforces its commitment to integrating global standards into its academic framework and promoting sustainability, equity, and innovation in education—values that are foundational to the SDG framework.

columns.title: General Assessment
content: Urdaneta City University's participation in the IEF Oman 2024 was a strategic and impactful initiative that successfully aligned with its goals of internationalization and global academic engagement. The event provided a platform for the university to showcase its programs, highlight its institutional achievements, and explore international partnerships. UCU made a positive impression among prospective students and partner institutions, positioning itself as a competitive and globally relevant academic institution.

The activity was also a valuable learning experience for the university's delegation, as it exposed them to emerging global trends in education, student mobility, and international recruitment. The exchange of ideas with fellow participants from around the world enriched UCU's understanding of how it can further enhance its offerings and adapt to the evolving demands of the global education market. The fair reinforced the importance of visibility, branding, and relationship-building in the international academic landscape.

Overall, the university’s involvement in IEF Oman 2024 can be considered a success. It not only advanced UCU’s international presence but also opened new doors for academic collaboration and innovation. The connections made during the event are expected to lead to future opportunities for student exchange, joint research, and faculty development, thereby strengthening UCU’s role in the global education community.

columns.title: Recommendations
content: To maximize the long-term benefits of participating in international fairs like IEF Oman, it is recommended that Urdaneta City University develop a follow-up strategy to nurture the connections and inquiries made during the event. This includes maintaining communication with interested students and potential partner institutions through personalized emails, virtual consultations, and digital brochures. Creating a dedicated internationalization team or office that handles these interactions can help sustain engagement, increase the likelihood of partnership agreements, and support international student admissions.

Additionally, the university should consider investing in more visible and interactive promotional materials, such as videos, virtual campus tours, and multilingual brochures, to better cater to diverse international audiences. Including testimonials from international students and highlighting UCU’s achievements in global rankings or research can also improve its appeal. Future participation in global events should be aligned with a comprehensive internationalization plan, ensuring that each engagement contributes to the broader goal of making UCU a globally recognized and collaborative institution.

title: INFORMATION SESSION ABOUT THE UPCOMING DISCOVERY CAMP HOSTED BY UNIVERSITI TEKNOLOGI BRUNEI

content: The Discovery Camp organized by Universiti Teknologi Brunei (UTB) was conceptualized in response to the increasing need for educational programs that not only develop academic and technical skills but also foster global awareness and cultural sensitivity. In today’s rapidly evolving world, equipping students with knowledge in science, technology, engineering, and mathematics (STEM), alongside cultural understanding, is vital for preparing them for future challenges. The camp aims to provide an immersive environment where participants can engage in experiential learning beyond the traditional classroom. This initiative supports UTB’s mission of producing competent, innovative, and globally-minded individuals ready to contribute meaningfully to their communities and beyond.

sections.title: This projects aims to:
items: Ignite curiosity and promote interest in innovation and technology among students
Nurture personal growth through cross-cultural exchange
Develop soft skills such as leadership, communication, and problem-solving
rovide clarity on educational pathways and career opportunities in STEM

sections.title: Contributions to the Sustainable Development Goals
content: The Discovery Camp aligns with several United Nations Sustainable Development Goals. It directly contributes to Goal 4, which advocates for quality education by offering a well-rounded, inclusive, and practical learning experience. It also supports Goal 9 by fostering a culture of innovation and technological literacy among youth. Furthermore, the camp’s focus on cultural exchange and international cooperation contributes to Goal 17 by encouraging partnerships and mutual understanding between diverse communities. These contributions position the camp not only as an educational initiative but as a meaningful contributor to sustainable global development.

columns.title: General Assessment
content: The Discovery Camp stands out as a holistic educational initiative that effectively blends academic enrichment with cultural engagement. Early feedback and evaluations from previous iterations suggest that students come away more motivated, confident, and aware of their academic and career potential. Educators and parents have noted significant growth in participants’ communication skills and openness to new ideas. The program also demonstrates UTB’s capacity to lead in innovative education while supporting national and international education goals.

columns.title: Recommendations
content: It is highly recommended that the Discovery Camp continue to be supported and expanded in future editions. Outreach efforts should be increased to include more schools, particularly those from rural or underserved areas, to ensure equitable access to this opportunity. Collaboration with international institutions can further enrich the experience and deepen cultural exchange. Lastly, ongoing monitoring and assessment should be conducted to continuously improve the program and align it even more closely with both national education goals and global sustainability objectives.

title: INITIAL MEETING WITH LAMPANG RAJABHAT UNIVERISTY

content: The initial meeting with Lampang Rajabhat University (LRU) marks the beginning of a promising partnership between our institution and one of Thailand's distinguished academic entities. LRU has earned a strong reputation for its commitment to quality education, academic excellence, and the holistic development of its students. With robust programs in education, humanities, social sciences, business administration, and science and technology, LRU provides a comprehensive learning experience that aligns well with the values and direction of our university.

This meeting served as a platform to explore areas of mutual interest and academic collaboration, particularly in light of LRU’s strong emphasis on internationalization. Both institutions recognize the need for cross-border partnerships in preparing students for global citizenship. Discussions included potential faculty and student exchanges, joint research projects, and co-developed academic programs aimed at enriching educational outcomes and fostering intercultural competencies.

sections.title: This projects aims:
items: To establish formal academic ties and collaborative relations with Lampang Rajabhat University.
To explore opportunities for joint programs, research initiatives, and faculty/student exchanges.
To support the internationalization agenda of both institutions through cross-cultural academic engagements.

sections.title: Contributions to the Sustainable Development Goals
content: This partnership contributes directly to the United Nations Sustainable Development Goal 4: Quality Education by fostering access to inclusive and equitable educational opportunities through cross-institutional learning and joint academic programs. It also advances SDG 17: Partnerships for the Goals by building a global network committed to educational excellence, capacity building, and collaborative research. Moreover, through cultural and academic exchanges, the collaboration indirectly supports SDG 10: Reduced Inequalities by promoting inclusive mobility and educational equity across borders.

columns.title: General Assessment
content: The initial meeting was highly successful in setting a foundation for a strong academic partnership. It demonstrated a clear alignment between the institutional goals of our university and Lampang Rajabhat University, particularly in the areas of quality education, research, and internationalization. The dialogue was open and insightful, offering practical pathways toward future academic engagement.

Participants from both sides were proactive in identifying programs and projects that would benefit from joint implementation. There was evident enthusiasm for promoting cross-cultural exchanges and broadening the global competencies of students and faculty. The meeting fostered a spirit of unity and shared purpose, which is crucial in international academic collaboration.

Overall, the session was productive and paved the way for a formal partnership. With both institutions expressing readiness to proceed, the meeting has laid a solid groundwork for creating meaningful educational linkages. The collaborative energy and shared commitment observed in this session are strong indicators of future success.

columns.title: Recommendations
content: It is recommended that both institutions immediately proceed with the drafting and signing of a Memorandum of Understanding to formalize the partnership. This will serve as a framework for implementing specific academic activities such as exchange programs, collaborative research, and shared educational resources.

Furthermore, the creation of a joint working committee should be considered to oversee the planning and monitoring of collaborative initiatives. Regular communication, clear timelines, and mutually agreed-upon objectives will ensure that the partnership remains dynamic, sustainable, and impactful for both universities.

title: Konan University Hirao School of Management - Japan

content: Internationalization has become a strategic imperative for Urdaneta City University, particularly in business and management programs where global outlook and cross-cultural competence are decisive graduate attributes. Konan University’s Hirao School of Management in Kobe, Japan, is widely regarded for its industry-embedded curriculum, strong links to the Kansai business ecosystem, and emphasis on experiential learning.

Inviting a Konan delegation to UCU offers an opportunity to benchmark our practices against an AACSB-accredited peer, explore joint research themes such as entrepreneurship and sustainable supply-chain management, and lay the groundwork for two-way student mobility. The visit underscores both institutions’ commitment to cultivating globally attuned managers who can navigate dynamic, interconnected markets.

sections.title: This projects aims to:
items: Identify complementary research areas and outline a joint working plan for collaborative projects.
Explore frameworks for reciprocal student and faculty exchange programs beginning next academic year.
Share best practices in curriculum design, industry engagement, and quality assurance to inform mutual program improvements.

sections.title: Contributions to the Sustainable Development Goals
content: The engagement advances SDG 4 (Quality Education) by integrating diverse pedagogical models and international perspectives into management curricula. It supports SDG 8 (Decent Work & Economic Growth) through research and training that enhance employability and entrepreneurial skills. Finally, by forging a cross-border institutional alliance, the activity reinforces SDG 17 (Partnerships for the Goals), demonstrating how higher-education collaboration can accelerate knowledge exchange and sustainable development.

columns.title: General Assessment
content: Participants rated the visit highly productive, citing the clear alignment between Konan’s experiential learning ethos and UCU’s community-oriented mission. Immediate outcomes include a draft memorandum of intent for a semester-long student exchange and a concept note for a comparative study on sustainable business practices in the Philippines and Japan.

Both sides recognized strong complementarities in industry linkages: Konan’s connections to Japanese manufacturers can match UCU’s relationships with Philippine agribusiness cooperatives, paving the way for cross-sector research and internship pipelines.

Challenges identified revolve around synchronizing academic calendars and managing language preparation for exchange students, but preliminary solutions—such as short pre-departure Japanese language modules and flexible credit mapping—were tabled during the debriefing. Overall, the visit set a solid foundation for a long-term, mutually beneficial partnership.

columns.title: Recommendations
content: Formalize the draft memorandum of intent into a signed agreement within the next quarter, specifying exchange quotas, credit-transfer policies, and joint research funding mechanisms. Establishing a bi-institutional steering committee will ensure deadlines are met and accountability is clear.

Develop a pilot virtual exchange course on comparative Asian business models as an interim step toward full mobility. This low-cost initiative will build intercultural competence, test IT infrastructure, and generate early evidence of learning gains to support future grant applications tied to the Sustainable Development Goals.

The Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) signing between Mariano Marcos State University’s Batac campus (MMSU-BATAC) and the University of the Philippines Los Baños (UPLB) marks a strategic collaboration between two prominent educational institutions in the Philippines. This partnership aims to foster academic cooperation, research collaboration, and resource sharing to enhance educational programs and community development initiatives. Both MMSU-BATAC and UPLB are committed to leveraging their expertise and resources to address regional and national challenges, promote sustainable development, and improve the quality of education and research output. The MOU formalizes their shared goals of innovation, knowledge exchange, and capacity building, creating opportunities for faculty and student mobility, joint projects, and the advancement of science and technology in various fields.

sections.title: This projects aims to:
items: Establish formal collaboration between MMSU-BATAC and UPLB to promote academic and research cooperation.
Facilitate resource sharing including facilities, expertise, and information to enhance educational and community development programs.
Encourage faculty and student exchanges to foster knowledge transfer and capacity building.
Develop joint research projects addressing regional and national issues, especially in agriculture, environment, and technology.

sections.title: Contributions to the Sustainable Development Goals
content: The Memorandum of Understanding between MMSU-BATAC and UPLB contributes significantly to the achievement of several Sustainable Development Goals. By fostering collaborative research and academic programs, the partnership supports SDG 4 (Quality Education) through improved educational quality and accessibility. The joint focus on agriculture, environmental management, and technology aligns with SDG 2 (Zero Hunger) and SDG 13 (Climate Action) by promoting sustainable farming practices and climate resilience. Additionally, the exchange of expertise and resources advances SDG 9 (Industry, Innovation, and Infrastructure) by encouraging innovation and scientific progress. The collaboration embodies SDG 17 (Partnerships for the Goals), emphasizing the importance of multi-institutional cooperation to address complex challenges and foster sustainable development at local and national levels.

columns.title: General Assessment
content: The signing of the Memorandum of Understanding between MMSU-BATAC and UPLB represents a significant step toward strengthening academic collaboration and research innovation. This partnership effectively leverages the complementary strengths of both institutions, enabling them to address shared challenges in agriculture, environmental sustainability, and technology development. The agreement fosters opportunities for faculty and student exchanges, joint research, and resource sharing, which are expected to enhance educational quality and community impact. Overall, the MOU signifies a positive move toward sustainable development and capacity building, positioning both universities as key contributors to regional and national progress.

To maximize the benefits of the MMSU-BATAC and UPLB partnership, it is recommended to actively implement and monitor joint research projects and exchange programs. Both institutions should establish clear communication channels and designate coordinators to ensure smooth collaboration. Expanding community outreach initiatives will enhance the social impact of the partnership. Regular evaluation of outcomes will help identify areas for improvement and ensure alignment with sustainable development goals. Additionally, increasing awareness and engagement among faculty and students will foster a stronger commitment to shared objectives.

columns.title: Recommendations
content: Formalize the draft memorandum of intent into a signed agreement within the next quarter, specifying exchange quotas, credit-transfer policies, and joint research funding mechanisms. Establishing a bi-institutional steering committee will ensure deadlines are met and accountability is clear.

Develop a pilot virtual exchange course on comparative Asian business models as an interim step toward full mobility. This low-cost initiative will build intercultural competence, test IT infrastructure, and generate early evidence of learning gains to support future grant applications tied to the Sustainable Development Goals.

The National Service Training Program (NSTP) is a key component of civic education in the Philippines, designed to enhance the youth’s active contribution to nation-building. As part of its continuing mission to cultivate responsible citizenship and disaster preparedness, a seminar on NSTP and Rescue 177 is being organized. This initiative seeks to deepen participants' understanding of the importance of community service, emergency response, and volunteerism.

Rescue 177, known for its dedication to rapid and effective emergency response, will play a central role in facilitating the seminar. Through a combination of lectures, interactive workshops, and practical simulations, students and community members will be equipped with essential skills and knowledge to effectively respond to emergencies and contribute meaningfully to community safety and resilience.

This seminar underscores the vital role of preparedness, teamwork, and civic duty in facing the challenges of natural and man-made disasters. By engaging in this activity, participants are not only trained for emergencies but are also empowered to become proactive citizens capable of making a positive impact in their communities.

sections.title: This projects aims:
items: To increase participants’ understanding of the National Service Training Program and the vital role of emergency response in community development.
To educate students and community members on the importance of disaster preparedness and effective emergency response techniques.
To provide hands-on training and practical workshops that equip participants with basic first aid, rescue operations, and emergency response skills.
To inspire a sense of civic duty, volunteerism, and social responsibility among the youth and community members.

sections.title: Contributions to the Sustainable Development Goals
content: The NSTP and Rescue 177 seminar contributes significantly to the achievement of several United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). By promoting emergency preparedness, community service, and civic engagement, the seminar directly supports SDG 3: Good Health and Well-being by equipping participants with life-saving knowledge and skills in first aid and disaster response. It also aligns with SDG 4: Quality Education, offering accessible, experiential learning opportunities that empower individuals through training and knowledge. Furthermore, the activity fosters a culture of volunteerism and social responsibility, contributing to SDG 11: Sustainable Cities and Communities by building safer, more resilient local environments. Through encouraging youth participation and leadership, the seminar also supports SDG 16: Peace, Justice, and Strong Institutions, by nurturing proactive, informed citizens who are ready to respond in times of crisis. Overall, the seminar plays a vital role in promoting sustainable development through education, empowerment, and community resilience.

columns.title: General Assessment
content: The NSTP and Rescue 177 seminar was a highly impactful and meaningful activity that successfully met its objectives of promoting emergency preparedness, civic responsibility, and community involvement. Participants actively engaged in both the theoretical and practical components of the seminar, showing enthusiasm and a strong willingness to learn. The sessions facilitated by Rescue 177 provided valuable insights into real-life emergency scenarios, equipping attendees with vital first aid and disaster response skills. Interactive workshops and simulations further enhanced the participants' understanding and readiness to act in emergency situations. The activity fostered teamwork, leadership, and a heightened sense of volunteerism among students and community members. Overall, the seminar effectively contributed to the personal growth of the participants and strengthened their role as proactive members of the community. It also aligned well with the goals of the NSTP and supported national efforts in building safer, more resilient communities. Future activities of similar nature are highly encouraged to reinforce the skills and values gained from this seminar.

columns.title: Recommendations
content: To further enhance the effectiveness of future NSTP and Rescue 177 seminars, it is recommended that similar activities be conducted regularly, ideally once per semester, to reinforce the skills and knowledge gained by participants. Increasing the number of hands-on activities and simulation exercises would significantly boost experiential learning and help students build confidence in emergency response situations. Expanding participation to include more community members, local officials, and other departments within the institution would foster greater collaboration and community awareness. It is also suggested to provide certificates of participation or recognition to motivate attendees and add value to their academic and professional development. Incorporating evaluation tools such as feedback forms or post-activity assessments would allow organizers to gather insights and improve future seminars. Lastly, maintaining and strengthening partnerships with organizations like Rescue 177, and seeking collaboration with other emergency response agencies, will ensure that participants continue to receive high-quality and diverse training experiences. These recommendations aim to sustain the positive impact of the seminar and encourage a culture of preparedness, volunteerism, and civic responsibility.

title: Online Short Course 2024 Organized by IOUB

content: In response to the growing demand for accessible and high-quality education, particularly in the era of globalization and digital transformation, Universitas Brawijaya through its International Office is proud to present the Online Short Course 2024. This program is designed to provide participants around the world with a dynamic and inclusive platform for academic and professional growth, regardless of geographical limitations. The Online Short Course 2024 aims to foster cross-cultural academic exchange and equip learners with up-to-date knowledge and practical skills in a variety of fields.
