With a commitment to academic excellence and international collaboration, this initiative brings together expert lecturers, practitioners, and participants in a virtual learning environment that promotes interactive learning, critical thinking, and global networking.

By offering a series of engaging lectures, hands-on workshops, and collaborative sessions, the program not only supports the internationalization of higher education but also aligns with Universitas Brawijaya's mission to contribute meaningfully to global education. Participants will gain valuable insights, expand their professional networks, and earn a certificate of completion that underscores their commitment to continuous learning and development. Through this initiative, Universitas Brawijaya reaffirms its dedication to creating innovative educational opportunities that are inclusive, impactful, and globally relevant.

sections.title: This projects aims:
items: To provide participants with in-depth knowledge and practical skills in selected academic and professional fields through expert-led lectures and interactive learning sessions.
To foster cross-cultural understanding and collaboration by bringing together participants and instructors from diverse international backgrounds.
To encourage a culture of continuous education by offering flexible, accessible, and high-quality learning opportunities through an online platform.
To create opportunities for participants to build international networks that support future academic, professional, and collaborative endeavors.

sections.title: Contributions to the Sustainable Development Goals
content: The Online Short Course 2024 organized by the International Office of Universitas Brawijaya contributes meaningfully to the achievement of the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs), particularly in the areas of Quality Education (SDG 4), Reduced Inequalities (SDG 10), and Partnerships for the Goals (SDG 17). By offering accessible, inclusive, and high-quality learning opportunities through a virtual platform, the program promotes lifelong learning and helps bridge educational gaps across regions. It encourages the participation of individuals from diverse backgrounds, supporting equity in access to knowledge and skills regardless of geographic or socioeconomic constraints. Additionally, the course fosters international collaboration and academic exchange, strengthening global partnerships and contributing to the development of more inclusive and sustainable education systems. Through its design and implementation, the program aligns with the global agenda to build resilient, educated, and interconnected communities.

columns.title: General Assessment
content: The Online Short Course 2024 is expected to be a successful and impactful initiative, providing a valuable platform for international academic exchange and skill development. Participants are anticipated to show high levels of engagement and active participation throughout the program, as the course design emphasizes interactive learning through lectures, discussions, and workshops. Feedback will be gathered through surveys and evaluations to assess the effectiveness of the content delivery, the relevance of the topics, and overall participant satisfaction. The program’s impact will be measured based on learning outcomes, cross-cultural interactions, and the extent to which participants achieve their personal and professional development goals. Additionally, the issuance of certificates will serve as formal recognition of each participant’s commitment and achievement. Overall, the program is expected to contribute positively to Universitas Brawijaya’s internationalization efforts and to support global educational goals by fostering inclusive, accessible, and high-quality learning experiences.

columns.title: Recommendations
content: To further enhance the effectiveness of future NSTP and Rescue 177 seminars, it is recommended that similar activities be conducted regularly, ideally once per semester, to reinforce the skills and knowledge gained by participants. Increasing the number of hands-on activities and simulation exercises would significantly boost experiential learning and help students build confidence in emergency response situations. Expanding participation to include more community members, local officials, and other departments within the institution would foster greater collaboration and community awareness. It is also suggested to provide certificates of participation or recognition to motivate attendees and add value to their academic and professional development. Incorporating evaluation tools such as feedback forms or post-activity assessments would allow organizers to gather insights and improve future seminars. Lastly, maintaining and strengthening partnerships with organizations like Rescue 177, and seeking collaboration with other emergency response agencies, will ensure that participants continue to receive high-quality and diverse training experiences. These recommendations aim to sustain the positive impact of the seminar and encourage a culture of preparedness, volunteerism, and civic responsibility.

Continuous quality improvement is a cornerstone of our institutional strategy, and benchmarking against recognized centers of excellence allows us to calibrate our standards and practices. Philippine Normal University (PNU), as the National Center for Teacher Education, offers a rich reference point for cutting-edge pedagogy, robust research culture, and efficient institutional governance. Recognizing this, a multidisciplinary delegation visited PNU to observe operations firsthand, exchange insights with administrators and faculty, and identify transferrable models that could elevate our own programs. The visit reaffirmed the value of systematic peer learning and set the stage for deeper collaboration in the future.

sections.title: This projects aims to:
items: Examine PNU’s curriculum design and instructional innovations for potential adoption or adaptation.
Study research support mechanisms—grants, mentoring, and publication incentives—to strengthen our own scholarly ecosystem.
Review administrative and quality-assurance frameworks that sustain PNU’s accreditation standing.
Explore opportunities for joint projects, faculty exchanges, and shared professional-development initiatives.
Gather evidence-based insights to inform the revision of our strategic plan and operational guidelines.

sections.title: Contributions to the Sustainable Development Goals
content: The benchmarking activity advances SDG 4 (Quality Education) by integrating proven pedagogical models and research support systems into our own institution. It fosters SDG 17 (Partnerships for the Goals) through emergent collaborative pathways with PNU. By examining governance practices that promote transparency and accountability, the visit also supports SDG 16 (Peace, Justice & Strong Institutions), ensuring our organizational structures remain resilient and learner-centered.

columns.title: General Assessment
content: Participants consistently rated the visit as highly productive, citing PNU’s systematic alignment of teaching, research, and service as a standout model. The delegation gained actionable insights into curriculum mapping, outcome-based assessment, and resource optimization, all backed by clear metrics of success.

Equally valuable were the dialogues on faculty workload balancing and incentive structures that promote both teaching excellence and research productivity. These conversations underscored the importance of integrated support systems rather than isolated interventions.

Overall, the benchmarking exercise validated many of our existing initiatives while revealing practical enhancements—especially in digital learning infrastructure and cross-functional governance—that can accelerate our progress toward institutional goals.

columns.title: Recommendations
content: We should prioritize the adoption of PNU’s outcome-based curriculum audit framework, customizing its performance rubrics to align with our program objectives and accreditation requirements. Establishing a dedicated task force to oversee this adaptation would ensure coherent implementation and timely feedback loops.

Concurrently, we should pilot a research incentive scheme modeled on PNU’s tiered approach, combining seed grants, publication rewards, and mentorship credits. Embedding this within an integrated data dashboard will allow real-time tracking of outputs, strengthen accountability, and foster a culture of continuous improvement linked to the Sustainable Development Goals.

For more than a decade, the University has sought data-driven ways to raise research quality, benchmark performance, and increase global reach. Until now, fragmented databases and ad-hoc analytics limited our ability to map emerging fields or track citation impact comprehensively. Web of Science (WoS)—with its curated index of 34,000+ journals and powerful analytics suite—offers an integrated solution. Partnering with WoS gives our faculty and students authoritative coverage across all disciplines, field-normalized citation metrics, and collaboration-mapping tools that directly support strategic research planning and capacity-building.

sections.title: This projects aims to:
items: Provide the entire academic community with seamless access to WoS Core Collection and specialized indices (e.g., BIOSIS, Derwent).
Train faculty and graduate students on advanced search strategies, citation analysis, and journal selection.
Integrate WoS analytics into institutional research dashboards for real-time performance monitoring.
Facilitate interdisciplinary collaboration by mapping co-authorship networks and high-impact research clusters.

sections.title: Contributions to the Sustainable Development Goals
content: The collaboration directly advances SDG 4 (Quality Education) by enriching teaching and learning with premium scholarly resources; SDG 9 (Industry, Innovation & Infrastructure) through data-guided innovation pipelines and technology transfer insights; and SDG 17 (Partnerships for the Goals) by fostering global research networks and open, metrics-based accountability. The resulting improvements in knowledge creation, dissemination, and collaboration strengthen the University’s capacity to contribute solutions to other SDGs—such as health, climate action, and sustainable communities—through higher-quality, better-targeted research.

columns.title: General Assessment
content: Early uptake has been strong: log-file analytics show that 78 % of active researchers accessed WoS within the first eight weeks, and workshop attendance averaged 95 participants per session. Faculty feedback highlights improved confidence in journal targeting and greater awareness of bibliometric best practices.

Quantitatively, the proportion of papers submitted to Q1 journals (as per Journal Citation Reports) rose from 42 % to 57 % in the first semester following implementation. Preliminary citation tracking for recently accepted papers already shows a higher CNCI compared with previous cohorts, suggesting positive momentum in research impact.

Qualitatively, interdisciplinary teams report that the collaboration-network visualizations helped them discover unexpected partners within engineering, public health, and social sciences, leading to three new externally funded proposals. Challenges remain—chiefly the need for sustained user training and careful interpretation of metrics to avoid perverse incentives—but overall the collaboration is meeting or exceeding initial expectations.

columns.title: Recommendations
content: To capitalize on the early success, the University should institutionalize an annual “Research Analytics Week” featuring advanced WoS masterclasses, discipline-specific clinics, and showcases of high-impact projects discovered through WoS data. Embedding these events in the academic calendar will reinforce a data-literate research culture and keep skills current.

Secondly, leadership should establish a continuous improvement loop by pairing WoS indicators with qualitative peer review in promotion, tenure, and funding decisions. This balanced, context-aware approach will safeguard against metric misuse while ensuring that the collaboration remains aligned with the University’s mission and the broader Sustainable Development Goals.

title: SM CITY URDANETA & UCU – MOA SIGNING

content: In today’s competitive and dynamic job market, higher education institutions are continuously seeking meaningful partnerships with industry leaders to ensure their graduates are well-prepared for the workforce. Recognizing this, Urdaneta City University (UCU) has entered into a Memorandum of Agreement (MOA) with SM City Urdaneta. This collaboration was established with the aim of enhancing the academic experience of students by complementing classroom-based education with hands-on industry exposure. Such partnerships are essential in addressing the existing gap between theoretical knowledge and practical skills, thereby increasing the employability and career readiness of university graduates.

sections.title: This projects aims to:
items: Integrate academic learning with industry practices
Allow students to apply their knowledge in professional settings
Ensure the curriculum remains aligned with current market trends and industry standards
Foster mutual development between the university and the business sector

sections.title: Contributions to the Sustainable Development Goals
content: This initiative significantly contributes to the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals, particularly Goal 4 (Quality Education), Goal 8 (Decent Work and Economic Growth), and Goal 17 (Partnerships for the Goals). By facilitating access to quality internships and practical training, the partnership ensures that students are better equipped for meaningful employment. It also supports inclusive and sustainable economic growth by building a workforce that meets the demands of local and national industries. The collaboration exemplifies how strategic partnerships can foster innovation and shared progress in both education and economic development.

columns.title: General Assessment
content: This collaboration between UCU and SM City Urdaneta represents a significant step toward enriching the academic experience through strategic industry involvement. It not only strengthens the practical capabilities of students but also provides the university with valuable insights to align its programs with evolving industry needs. Early indicators suggest strong enthusiasm from both faculty and students, with expectations that the initiative will significantly boost employability outcomes and strengthen UCU’s role in community and workforce development.

columns.title: Recommendations
content: It is recommended that this partnership be continuously evaluated and expanded to include more departments and program areas within both institutions. Further, establishing a feedback mechanism involving student interns, faculty mentors, and industry supervisors will help refine the program and ensure its effectiveness. Encouraging other academic institutions and industry players to replicate such collaborations can foster a culture of cooperative learning and sustainable professional development across the region.

In today’s rapidly globalizing world, educational institutions are increasingly recognizing the importance of international collaboration and networking to enhance academic quality, cultural understanding, and research innovation. Urdaneta City University’s decision to join the Global School Alliance aligns with this global trend, reflecting its commitment to providing education that meets international standards and prepares students for the challenges of a connected world. The Global School Alliance is a prestigious international network of educational institutions dedicated to fostering global partnerships, sharing best practices, and promoting educational excellence across borders.

Becoming a registered member of this alliance enables Urdaneta City University to engage in various collaborative initiatives, including cultural exchange programs, joint research projects, and innovative teaching methodologies. This membership not only elevates the university’s academic profile but also supports its mission to develop globally competent graduates who are equipped with the skills, knowledge, and perspectives necessary to thrive in diverse environments.

The certification of membership symbolizes a milestone in the university’s ongoing efforts to internationalize its curriculum, enhance student and faculty mobility, and contribute to sustainable development through education. It also provides a platform to strengthen partnerships that are vital for addressing complex global challenges and advancing the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs).

sections.title: This projects aims to:
items: Formalize Urdaneta City University’s membership in the Global School Alliance, establishing its participation in a global educational network.
Enhance the university’s international collaboration by engaging in joint initiatives with member institutions worldwide.
Promote cultural exchange and global awareness among students, faculty, and staff through alliance programs and activities.
Improve educational quality by adopting best practices, innovative teaching methods, and research collaborations facilitated by the alliance.

sections.title: Contributions to the Sustainable Development Goals
content: Urdaneta City University’s membership in the Global School Alliance significantly contributes to several Sustainable Development Goals. By enhancing educational quality and promoting inclusive and equitable education, the activity supports SDG 4 (Quality Education). The cultural exchange programs fostered through this network encourage mutual understanding and respect among diverse communities, advancing SDG 16 (Peace, Justice, and Strong Institutions). Engagement in innovative research projects contributes to SDG 9 (Industry, Innovation, and Infrastructure) by supporting scientific progress and knowledge sharing. Furthermore, the global partnerships align with SDG 17 (Partnerships for the Goals), emphasizing the importance of collaboration to achieve sustainable development. Together, these contributions help prepare students with the skills and global perspectives necessary to address complex societal challenges and promote sustainable growth.

columns.title: General Assessment
content: Urdaneta City University’s certification as a registered member of the Global School Alliance marks a significant step in its journey toward internationalization and academic excellence. This membership has effectively expanded the university’s global network, providing valuable opportunities for collaboration, cultural exchange, and research innovation. The affiliation has enhanced the university’s capacity to adopt international best practices and enrich its educational programs with global perspectives, thereby better preparing students for the challenges of an interconnected world. Overall, this development reflects the university’s strong commitment to quality education, global engagement, and sustainable development, positioning it as a forward-looking institution dedicated to fostering lifelong learning and inclusive growth.

columns.title: Recommendations
content: To fully leverage its membership in the Global School Alliance, Urdaneta City University should actively engage in collaborative projects and initiatives with other member institutions to enhance academic quality and innovation. It is recommended to encourage participation of both faculty and students in exchange programs, joint research, and cultural activities to foster global competencies. Strengthening internal capacities through workshops and training will enable the university community to maximize the benefits of this membership. Additionally, raising awareness about the alliance and its opportunities within the university will promote greater involvement. Regularly assessing the outcomes of the membership will help align activities with the university’s strategic goals and ensure continuous improvement towards achieving sustainable development objectives.

title: The 1ST National Workshop On UI Green Metric for Universities In Nigeria

content: In line with the global call for environmental responsibility and sustainable development in higher education, the inaugural National Workshop on UI GreenMetric for Universities in Nigeria was successfully launched via Zoom. This pioneering event aimed to promote awareness, foster dialogue, and strengthen the implementation of sustainability practices among Nigerian universities.

The workshop served as a platform for academic institutions to explore the UI GreenMetric framework—a global initiative that ranks universities based on their environmental sustainability performance. Participants engaged in discussions on green campus initiatives, sustainability indicators, and institutional strategies for improving environmental impact. The event featured insightful presentations from sustainability experts, interactive panel sessions, and opportunities for networking and knowledge sharing among participating universities.

This initiative reflects a growing commitment within the Nigerian higher education sector to prioritize environmental stewardship and align institutional practices with global sustainability standards. The workshop marks a significant step toward building a national network of environmentally conscious universities dedicated to shaping a greener and more sustainable future.

sections.title: This projects aims:
items: To introduce the UI GreenMetric World University Rankings and its relevance to sustainability in higher education institutions.
To promote awareness and understanding of sustainable campus practices among Nigerian universities.
To encourage the adoption and implementation of environmentally responsible policies and programs in academic institutions.
To provide a platform for sharing best practices, experiences, and strategies for achieving environmental excellence.

sections.title: Contributions to the Sustainable Development Goals
content: The inaugural National Workshop on UI GreenMetric for Universities in Nigeria makes a significant contribution to the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs), particularly in advancing environmental sustainability within the higher education sector. Most notably, the workshop supports SDG 4 (Quality Education) by promoting sustainability education and integrating environmental awareness into institutional practices and learning environments. It also directly aligns with SDG 11 (Sustainable Cities and Communities) and SDG 13 (Climate Action) by encouraging universities to adopt green campus initiatives, reduce their environmental footprint, and contribute to climate resilience. Furthermore, the workshop embodies the spirit of SDG 17 (Partnerships for the Goals) by fostering collaboration and knowledge-sharing among Nigerian universities and global sustainability networks. By equipping academic institutions with the tools, strategies, and frameworks to implement effective sustainability measures, this workshop helps pave the way for a more environmentally conscious and sustainable future across the Nigerian higher education landscape.

columns.title: General Assessment
content: The inaugural National Workshop on UI GreenMetric for Universities in Nigeria was a highly successful and impactful event. It effectively met its objectives by raising awareness of sustainability practices and introducing universities to the UI GreenMetric framework. The active participation of academic institutions from across the country reflected a strong and growing interest in environmental stewardship within the higher education sector.

The quality of presentations and the diversity of perspectives shared during the workshop enriched the learning experience for all participants. Interactive sessions encouraged meaningful dialogue, allowed for the exchange of best practices, and highlighted the current efforts and challenges faced by Nigerian universities in implementing green campus initiatives. The virtual format proved to be inclusive and efficient, enabling wide participation despite geographical constraints.

Overall, the workshop strengthened national momentum for sustainability in higher education and laid the foundation for continued collaboration and progress. It affirmed the commitment of Nigerian universities to contribute to global sustainability goals and underscored the importance of institutional leadership in driving environmental change.

columns.title: Recommendations
content: To build on the success of the inaugural National Workshop on UI GreenMetric for Universities in Nigeria, it is recommended that similar workshops be held regularly to sustain momentum, deepen institutional engagement, and provide updates on evolving sustainability standards and practices. Future events could include capacity-building sessions, hands-on training, and case studies from top-performing universities to further guide institutions in implementing effective sustainability measures.

It is also recommended that participating universities establish dedicated sustainability offices or task forces to oversee the planning and execution of green initiatives on their campuses. These bodies should be responsible for monitoring progress, preparing data for the UI GreenMetric submission, and fostering a culture of environmental responsibility among students and staff.

Additionally, the creation of a national network or consortium of universities participating in the UI GreenMetric initiative would strengthen collaboration, promote shared learning, and facilitate joint projects. Finally, strong institutional support and leadership commitment are essential to ensure that sustainability becomes a strategic priority and is integrated into university policies, curricula, and operations.

Urdaneta City University’s College of Teacher Education has prioritized continuous improvement of its Physical Education (PE) curriculum to meet evolving international standards and student needs. While local initiatives have upgraded facilities and teaching capacity, true global benchmarking requires external expertise, diverse perspectives, and sustained scholarly collaboration

The newly signed Memorandum of Agreement (MoA) with the International Association of Physical Education and Sports (iAPES) provides that gateway. iAPES, an established consortium of universities and practitioners, offers research depth, exchange opportunities, and innovative pedagogy that will enable UCU to enrich its academic offerings, elevate research output, and better prepare future PE teachers for a rapidly changing educational landscape.

sections.title: This projects aims:
items: Launch joint research projects on contemporary PE themes (e.g., adaptive sports, digital coaching tools).
Facilitate semester-long faculty exchanges for co-teaching and curriculum development.
Implement student-mobility programs—virtual and in-person—to expose pre-service teachers to diverse PE practices.
Co-create innovative teaching modules and assessment tools aligned with global PE standards.
Host annual symposia and workshops to disseminate findings and broaden stakeholder engagement.

sections.title: Contributions to the Sustainable Development Goals
content: The collaboration advances SDG 3 (Good Health & Well-Being) by promoting high-quality, inclusive physical-activity programs; SDG 4 (Quality Education) through modernized pedagogy and internationalized curricula; and SDG 17 (Partnerships for the Goals) by linking UCU to a global professional network. Indirectly, inclusive PE frameworks contribute to SDG 10 (Reduced Inequalities) by supporting gender-sensitive and adaptive sports opportunities for all learners.

columns.title: General Assessment
content: Early indicators are positive. Administrative support is strong: seed funding for outbound mobility is allocated, and a cross-functional steering committee meets monthly to track milestones. Faculty surveys reveal high enthusiasm for mentorship and exposure to global trends they previously accessed only through conferences.

Benchmarking data from prior iAPES collaborations show partner institutions typically record a 20–30 % rise in PE-related publications within three years. Given UCU’s baseline of five indexed papers annually, a realistic target is eight to ten papers per year by the end of the MoA’s initial term.

Student engagement looks promising as well. A pilot survey of sophomore PE majors found 88 % interest in virtual exchanges and 74 % willingness to join in-person programs, indicating a receptive cohort for international collaboration.

Potential challenges include funding sustainability for travel and ensuring that mobility schedules do not clash with local academic calendars. Continuous monitoring—both quantitative (research output, participation rates) and qualitative (student reflections, peer reviews)—will be vital to verify impact and guide course corrections.

columns.title: Recommendations
content: Institutionalize Support Mechanisms. Establish a dedicated Global PE Office to manage logistics, secure external grants, and integrate exchange activities into academic calendars. A recurring budget line for mobility grants and online platforms will ensure continuity beyond the MoA’s initial three-year scope.

Adopt a Balanced Evaluation Framework. Pair bibliometric indicators (e.g., journal quartiles, citation counts) with qualitative peer reviews and student-well-being metrics. This holistic approach will capture the full educational value of the partnership, prevent over-reliance on publication counts, and maintain alignment with UCU’s mission and the Sustainable Development Goals.

In line with Urdaneta City University’s (UCU) commitment to fostering career readiness and ensuring meaningful employment for its graduates, a strategic meeting was held between UCU and the Department of Labor and Employment (DOLE) Region 1. This engagement served as a platform to solidify institutional partnerships aimed at enhancing student employability and addressing workforce needs.

The meeting focused on the development and implementation of collaborative employment programs, skills training initiatives, and labor market integration strategies. Both parties explored ways to improve job placement services and ensure that UCU graduates are well-prepared for current and future labor market demands. One key area of discussion centered on aligning academic curricula with evolving industry standards to ensure that UCU’s educational offerings remain responsive and relevant.

This partnership underscores the shared vision of UCU and DOLE to provide students with the competencies, tools, and opportunities necessary for workforce success. The initiative also reflects a broader goal of bridging the gap between education and employment, ultimately contributing to regional economic growth and development.

sections.title: This projects aims:
items: To strengthen the partnership between Urdaneta City University and DOLE Region 1 in support of employment generation, skills development, and labor market integration for UCU students.
To identify collaborative initiatives that enhance career development programs, including job placement services, career guidance, and labor market information dissemination.
To align academic curricula with industry needs and labor market trends, ensuring that graduates are equipped with relevant competencies and skills required by employers.
To develop strategies for effective implementation of employment and training programs that support student transition from education to the workforce.

sections.title: Contributions to the Sustainable Development Goals
content: The partnership between Urdaneta City University (UCU) and the Department of Labor and Employment (DOLE) Region 1 contributes significantly to the achievement of the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). It directly supports SDG 4 (Quality Education) by promoting the alignment of academic programs with current industry demands, ensuring that students are equipped with relevant knowledge and practical skills. Through enhanced training opportunities and career development initiatives, the collaboration fosters lifelong learning and improves the overall quality of education. It also advances SDG 8 (Decent Work and Economic Growth) by strengthening employment programs, improving job placement services, and increasing students’ readiness for the labor market. This helps reduce youth unemployment and supports inclusive economic growth. Furthermore, the initiative exemplifies SDG 17 (Partnerships for the Goals) by fostering strong collaboration between the education sector and government agencies. Through shared commitment and coordinated efforts, UCU and DOLE are building a sustainable bridge between education and employment, contributing to the broader goals of national and global development.

columns.title: General Assessment
content: The meeting between Urdaneta City University (UCU) and the Department of Labor and Employment (DOLE) Region 1 was highly productive and successful in achieving its intended goals. It served as a vital platform for both institutions to align their efforts in enhancing employment opportunities and workforce readiness for UCU students. The open exchange of ideas, shared objectives, and proactive planning reflected a strong commitment to collaborative action and mutual support.

Participants actively engaged in meaningful discussions on job placement services, career development programs, and curriculum alignment with industry needs. The level of cooperation and strategic insight demonstrated during the meeting indicated a clear understanding of the challenges faced by graduating students and the importance of addressing them through institutional partnerships.

Overall, the activity strengthened the relationship between UCU and DOLE Region 1 and laid a solid foundation for future joint initiatives. It marked a significant step forward in bridging the gap between education and employment, contributing positively to the university’s mission of producing job-ready and industry-responsive graduates.

columns.title: Recommendations
content: To build on the success of the Alaminos IPD Seminar, it is recommended to organize regular follow-up sessions and workshops to deepen the knowledge and skills gained. Enhancing participant engagement through interactive activities and case studies can improve learning outcomes. Expanding outreach to include more diverse sectors and community members will foster broader collaboration. Additionally, establishing mechanisms for monitoring and evaluating the impact of the seminar will help in refining future programs and ensuring alignment with sustainable development goals. To build on the success of the initial meeting between Urdaneta City University (UCU) and the Department of Labor and Employment (DOLE) Region 1, it is recommended that both parties formalize their partnership through a Memorandum of Agreement (MOA) that outlines specific areas of collaboration, timelines, and responsibilities. Regular coordination meetings and joint planning sessions should be conducted to monitor the progress of agreed initiatives and ensure sustained alignment with labor market trends.

It is also recommended that UCU establish a dedicated career development and placement unit in close coordination with DOLE to facilitate employment services, conduct labor market assessments, and offer skills enhancement programs. Furthermore, incorporating industry consultations into curriculum review processes will help maintain the relevance of academic offerings.

Finally, both institutions should explore opportunities for student internships, job fairs, on-the-job training programs, and community-based employment projects. These initiatives will not only strengthen the employability of students but also reinforce the long-term impact of the partnership on regional workforce development.

We are pleased to announce the Virtual CommTECH 2024: Folktales Edition via zoom, discussing the wonderful folktales of Indonesia. First initiated in 2012, Institut Teknologi Sepuluh Nopember (ITS) launched Virtual Nusantara CommTECH 2024: Wonderful Folktales Indonesia, a fascinating short program aimed to introduce various Indonesian cultures to participants from all over the world to be conducted from June 24 to July 5 2024 every 14.00-17.00 GMT +7. Surabaya Indonesia Virtual CommTECH 2024, with its focus on Indonesian folktales via Zoom, provides an invaluable opportunity for students to explore and appreciate this rich cultural heritage.

sections.title: This projects aims:
items: To provide a platform for researchers, educators, authors, and professionals from various disciplines to present their scholarly work and share best practices.
To foster interdisciplinary collaboration and the exchange of innovative ideas that address current challenges in education, research, and community development.
To showcase exemplary teaching strategies through demo teaching sessions that enhance pedagogical skills and classroom effectiveness.

sections.title: Contributions to the Sustainable Development Goals
content: The 5th Multidisciplinary Research Conference, Demo Teaching, Global Leaders & Educators Awards, Huwarang Guro, and Search for Outstanding Authors & Writers Award contribute significantly to the achievement of the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). Most notably, the activity supports SDG 4: Quality Education by promoting academic excellence, sharing innovative teaching strategies, and encouraging lifelong learning among educators, students, and professionals. The research presentations and interdisciplinary discussions foster innovation and align with SDG 9: Industry, Innovation, and Infrastructur, as they address relevant societal issues through scholarly inquiry and creative solutions. By honoring individuals who have demonstrated exceptional leadership and service in education and research, the event contributes to SDG 16: Peace, Justice, and Strong Institution, reinforcing the values of integrity, inclusion, and effective leadership. Additionally, the collaborative nature of the conference, which involves participants from different institutions and sectors, exemplifies SDG 17: Partnerships for the Goals, as it encourages the formation of meaningful academic and professional alliances that support sustainable development efforts both locally and globally.

columns.title: General Assessment
content: The 5th Multidisciplinary Research Conference, Demo Teaching, Global Leaders & Educators Awards, Huwarang Guro, and Search for Outstanding Authors & Writers Award was a well-executed and highly impactful event that successfully achieved its goals. It served as an effective platform for academic discourse, interdisciplinary collaboration, and professional development. The diversity of research presentations enriched the intellectual environment and encouraged participants to explore perspectives beyond their own fields. The demo teaching sessions provided practical insights into innovative educational strategies, making the event particularly beneficial for educators seeking to enhance their teaching practices.

The recognition of outstanding individuals through the various awards added significant value to the event, highlighting the importance of leadership, dedication, and excellence in education, research, and authorship. This acknowledgment not only honored the achievements of the awardees but also served as a powerful source of inspiration for all attendees. Overall, the event was well-organized, inclusive, and academically enriching, contributing meaningfully to both personal and institutional growth. It successfully fostered a culture of excellence and collaboration that aligns with national and global goals for education and sustainable development.

columns.title: Recommendations
content: To further enhance the effectiveness and impact of future editions of the Multidisciplinary Research Conference and associated award programs, several recommendations can be considered. First, the integration of more interactive components such as workshops, breakout sessions, and panel debates can deepen participant engagement and provide more opportunities for hands-on learning and collaboration. Second, expanding the use of digital platforms for hybrid or fully virtual participation can increase accessibility for international delegates and those from remote areas, thereby promoting inclusivity and global engagement. It is also recommended to offer post-conference opportunities such as publication in indexed journals or proceedings to ensure that the research presented has a lasting impact. Additionally, implementing a structured feedback system from participants can help organizers continuously improve the content, logistics, and overall experience of the event. Finally, establishing formal partnerships with academic institutions, government agencies, and industry leaders can strengthen the event’s sustainability and broaden its reach and relevance in addressing real-world challenges through education and research.

title: Virtual Information Session for Commtech Camp Highlights 2024

content: The Virtual Information Session for CommTECH Camp Highlights 2024 was organized to provide a platform for institutional representatives and stakeholders to engage in meaningful dialogue regarding the Institutional Development Plan (IDP). Held via Zoom, the session aimed to align the IDP with the newly introduced template, emphasizing the importance of accurate and strategic input gathering and consultation. The discussion also addressed the necessity to enhance the existing IDP (s. 2021) to ensure its relevance and effectiveness in guiding institutional progress. With the submission period scheduled from May 15 to June 14, 2024, participants were encouraged to review and revise their respective plans in alignment with updated requirements. The IDP is recognized not merely as a formal document but as a vital strategic framework that supports the university’s mission and vision, offering direction for sustainable growth, organizational improvement, and resilience in an ever-evolving educational environment.

sections.title: This projects aims:
items: To provide participants with a clear understanding of the updated Institutional Development Plan (IDP) template and its alignment with the goals of CommTECH Camp Highlights 2024.
To facilitate consultation and gather valuable inputs from stakeholders for the enhancement of the existing IDP (s. 2021).
To emphasize the importance of the IDP as a strategic tool in achieving the university’s mission, vision, and long-term development goals.

sections.title: Contributions to the Sustainable Development Goals
content: The Virtual Information Session for CommTECH Camp Highlights 2024 significantly contributes to the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) by fostering institutional planning that supports inclusive, equitable, and quality education (SDG 4). Through the alignment and improvement of the Institutional Development Plan (IDP), universities are encouraged to adopt long-term strategies that enhance access to education, improve infrastructure, and promote innovation in teaching and learning. Furthermore, the activity supports SDG 16 by promoting transparent and accountable institutional governance, ensuring that planning processes are participatory and evidence-based. By guiding universities in developing well-structured IDPs, the session also contributes to SDG 17 by strengthening partnerships among stakeholders, enhancing institutional capacity, and aligning educational goals with national and global development priorities. Overall, the session empowers higher education institutions to act as catalysts for sustainable growth, equity, and innovation in the educational sector.

columns.title: General Assessment
content: The Virtual Information Session for CommTECH Camp Highlights 2024 proved to be a timely and effective initiative in guiding academic institutions toward improved strategic planning and alignment with institutional goals. The session successfully clarified the purpose and structure of the revised Institutional Development Plan (IDP) template, providing participants with the necessary tools and knowledge to revise and enhance their existing IDPs. Active engagement from participants during discussions and consultations reflected a strong commitment to institutional growth and development. The session also highlighted the importance of collaborative input in shaping comprehensive and forward-looking plans. Overall, the activity was well-organized and met its objectives by fostering a shared understanding of institutional planning as a key element in achieving the university’s mission and vision. It also reinforced the significance of timely submission and adherence to quality standards in institutional documentation.

columns.title: Recommendations
content: To further strengthen the impact of the Virtual Information Session for CommTECH Camp Highlights 2024, it is recommended that follow-up workshops or technical assistance sessions be conducted to support institutions in the actual drafting and revision of their Institutional Development Plans (IDPs). Establishing a help desk or advisory team could also aid participants in addressing specific challenges related to the new template. Additionally, providing sample IDPs or case studies of best practices can serve as valuable references for institutions developing their plans. To encourage continuous improvement, periodic monitoring and feedback mechanisms should be implemented to assess the quality and effectiveness of submitted IDPs. Finally, greater emphasis should be placed on aligning institutional goals with national and global development agendas, such as the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs), to ensure that planning efforts contribute meaningfully to broader educational and societal progress.

title: Virtual Meeting with the Thailand Partners

content: In line with Urdaneta City University’s (UCU) vision to broaden its global engagement and promote academic excellence through international collaboration, a virtual meeting was successfully held with esteemed partner institutions from Thailand. This initiative aimed to strengthen existing ties and explore new opportunities for cooperation in the fields of education and research.

The meeting served as a dynamic platform to discuss potential joint projects, including academic research initiatives, student exchange programs, and faculty development opportunities. Both UCU and its Thai partners expressed a strong interest in creating programs that will enrich the educational experiences of students and provide international exposure to faculty members.

This activity reflects UCU’s continued commitment to fostering international partnerships, promoting cross-cultural academic exchange, and enhancing the quality of higher education through collaborative efforts. It marks another significant step toward the university’s goal of cultivating a globally competitive academic environment.

sections.title: This projects aims:
items: To strengthen academic and research collaboration between Urdaneta City University (UCU) and partner institutions in Thailand.
To explore opportunities for joint academic projects that support internationalization and knowledge sharing.
To initiate student exchange programs that promote cross-cultural learning and global exposure
To identify faculty development opportunities through international training, seminars, and collaborative research.

sections.title: Contributions to the Sustainable Development Goals
content: The successful virtual meeting between Urdaneta City University (UCU) and its partner institutions in Thailand contributes meaningfully to several United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). Primarily, it supports SDG 4 (Quality Education) by promoting international academic collaboration, encouraging the exchange of knowledge, and expanding access to global learning opportunities through joint research and student exchange programs. By enhancing faculty development and cross-border academic initiatives, the partnership also improves the quality and inclusiveness of higher education. Additionally, the meeting aligns with SDG 17 (Partnerships for the Goals) by fostering strong international collaboration between educational institutions. Through shared goals and coordinated actions, UCU and its Thai partners are contributing to the global effort to improve education systems, promote intercultural understanding, and build resilient international academic networks that support sustainable development.

columns.title: General Assessment
content: The virtual meeting between Urdaneta City University (UCU) and its partner institutions from Thailand was a significant and successful initiative that effectively laid the groundwork for enhanced international collaboration. The activity was well-organized and facilitated meaningful dialogue on academic and research cooperation, student mobility, and faculty development. Both parties demonstrated a strong commitment to building mutually beneficial relationships and actively contributed ideas for future joint initiatives.

The meeting achieved its objectives of fostering partnership, exploring collaborative programs, and promoting global academic engagement. The open exchange of ideas and shared enthusiasm for cross-cultural learning highlighted the potential for long-term cooperation. Overall, the activity not only strengthened international ties but also reinforced UCU’s commitment to global education, academic excellence, and innovation.

This initiative is expected to lead to tangible outcomes such as joint research projects, exchange programs, and collaborative events, all of which will contribute to the academic and professional growth of students and faculty members alike.

columns.title: Recommendations
content: To maximize the outcomes of the virtual meeting between Urdaneta City University (UCU) and its Thai partner institutions, it is recommended that both parties formalize their collaboration through a Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) that clearly outlines areas of cooperation, responsibilities, and timelines. Establishing a joint coordinating committee or focal persons from each institution would also help ensure the smooth implementation and monitoring of planned initiatives.

It is further recommended that specific joint programs be developed, such as short-term student exchange opportunities, collaborative research projects, virtual lectures, and faculty training workshops. These activities should be aligned with each institution’s strategic goals and academic strengths to create impactful and sustainable partnerships.

Lastly, both UCU and its partners should consider holding regular virtual follow-up meetings to assess progress, share best practices, and identify new areas for cooperation. Strengthening communication and commitment on both sides will help foster a vibrant and long-lasting international relationship that benefits students, faculty, and the broader academic community.

Intellectual property (IP) plays a pivotal role in fostering innovation, protecting creative works, and supporting the growth of knowledge-based economies. However, many researchers, innovators, and creators face challenges in understanding and navigating the legal and procedural requirements for IP registration. Recognizing this gap, the writeshop on intellectual property registration was initiated to provide targeted support and hands-on guidance to individuals and institutions engaged in research, development, and creative production. The writeshop responded to the increasing need for legal literacy and technical know-how in protecting intellectual assets, especially within academic and innovation-driven communities. This initiative reflects our ongoing commitment to supporting a culture of innovation and safeguarding original work in accordance with national and international IP standards.

sections.title: This projects aims to:
items: Provide participants with a clear and practical understanding of the various types of intellectual property and the procedures for their registration.
Enhance the capacity of participants—particularly researchers, faculty, and creators—to independently manage and protect their intellectual outputs.
Cultivate a proactive mindset toward IP registration as a fundamental component of research and innovation.

sections.title: Contributions to the Sustainable Development Goals
content: This writeshop supports multiple Sustainable Development Goals, notably SDG 9 (Industry, Innovation, and Infrastructure) and SDG 4 (Quality Education). By equipping participants with the knowledge and skills necessary to protect and commercialize intellectual property, the activity contributes to building resilient innovation ecosystems and strengthening institutional capacities. It also aligns with SDG 8 (Decent Work and Economic Growth), as the proper management of IP rights can enhance opportunities for entrepreneurship, commercialization, and economic sustainability. Furthermore, the initiative indirectly supports SDG 17 (Partnerships for the Goals), as it encourages collaboration between educational institutions, government agencies, and industry in promoting innovation and legal awareness.

columns.title: General Assessment
content: The writeshop was deemed a success based on participant feedback and engagement levels. Attendees expressed appreciation for the clarity of instruction, the relevance of topics discussed, and the practical orientation of the sessions. Many noted that the writeshop had empowered them to take immediate steps toward protecting their intellectual property, and had clarified misconceptions surrounding IP registration procedures. The expertise of the facilitators, coupled with the interactive format, contributed to a rich and meaningful learning experience. The event also highlighted the need for continued IP education and support within academic and research institutions, as well as the importance of institutional policies that encourage and reward innovation.

columns.title: Recommendations
content: Building on the momentum of this writeshop, it is recommended that similar initiatives be conducted regularly to reach a broader audience and to deepen participants’ understanding of more advanced IP topics such as licensing, commercialization, and international protection mechanisms. Institutions should also consider developing dedicated IP support offices or legal advisory units to assist faculty and students in navigating the IP landscape. Additionally, integrating IP education into academic curricula, particularly in research-intensive programs, would further institutionalize knowledge and awareness of intellectual property rights. Collaborative efforts with national IP offices, innovation hubs, and legal experts should be pursued to sustain a supportive ecosystem where creators feel encouraged and equipped to protect their intellectual contributions.

Intellectual property (IP) plays a pivotal role in fostering innovation, protecting creative works, and supporting the growth of knowledge-based economies. However, many researchers, innovators, and creators face challenges in understanding and navigating the legal and procedural requirements for IP registration. Recognizing this gap, the writeshop on intellectual property registration was initiated to provide targeted support and hands-on guidance to individuals and institutions engaged in research, development, and creative production. The writeshop responded to the increasing need for legal literacy and technical know-how in protecting intellectual assets, especially within academic and innovation-driven communities. This initiative reflects our ongoing commitment to supporting a culture of innovation and safeguarding original work in accordance with national and international IP standards.

sections.title: This projects aims to:
items: Provide participants with a clear and practical understanding of the various types of intellectual property and the procedures for their registration.
Enhance the capacity of participants—particularly researchers, faculty, and creators—to independently manage and protect their intellectual outputs.
Cultivate a proactive mindset toward IP registration as a fundamental component of research and innovation.

sections.title: Contributions to the Sustainable Development Goals
content: This writeshop supports multiple Sustainable Development Goals, notably SDG 9 (Industry, Innovation, and Infrastructure) and SDG 4 (Quality Education). By equipping participants with the knowledge and skills necessary to protect and commercialize intellectual property, the activity contributes to building resilient innovation ecosystems and strengthening institutional capacities. It also aligns with SDG 8 (Decent Work and Economic Growth), as the proper management of IP rights can enhance opportunities for entrepreneurship, commercialization, and economic sustainability. Furthermore, the initiative indirectly supports SDG 17 (Partnerships for the Goals), as it encourages collaboration between educational institutions, government agencies, and industry in promoting innovation and legal awareness.

columns.title: General Assessment
content: The writeshop was deemed a success based on participant feedback and engagement levels. Attendees expressed appreciation for the clarity of instruction, the relevance of topics discussed, and the practical orientation of the sessions. Many noted that the writeshop had empowered them to take immediate steps toward protecting their intellectual property, and had clarified misconceptions surrounding IP registration procedures. The expertise of the facilitators, coupled with the interactive format, contributed to a rich and meaningful learning experience. The event also highlighted the need for continued IP education and support within academic and research institutions, as well as the importance of institutional policies that encourage and reward innovation.

columns.title: Recommendations
content: Building on the momentum of this writeshop, it is recommended that similar initiatives be conducted regularly to reach a broader audience and to deepen participants’ understanding of more advanced IP topics such as licensing, commercialization, and international protection mechanisms. Institutions should also consider developing dedicated IP support offices or legal advisory units to assist faculty and students in navigating the IP landscape. Additionally, integrating IP education into academic curricula, particularly in research-intensive programs, would further institutionalize knowledge and awareness of intellectual property rights. Collaborative efforts with national IP offices, innovation hubs, and legal experts should be pursued to sustain a supportive ecosystem where creators feel encouraged and equipped to protect their intellectual contributions.

UI GreenMetric World University Rankings is a global initiative launched by Universitas Indonesia (UI) to promote sustainability in universities worldwide. The rankings evaluate universities based on their environmental policies, infrastructure, energy and climate change efforts, waste management, water usage, transportation systems, and education/research on sustainability.

In recent years, Philippine universities have become increasingly aware of the importance of sustainable development in higher education. To support this shift, the 1st National Workshop was held in 2023, serving as a foundational event to introduce the GreenMetric framework and encourage local universities to participate.

sections.title: This projects aims:
items: To provide Urdaneta City University with valuable knowledge on sustainability and environmental responsibility within the context of higher education.

To engage experts, faculty, and sustainability advocates in sharing effective strategies for improving campus sustainability, including waste management, energy usage, water conservation, and green building practices.
To support UCU in advancing its sustainability programs by aligning efforts with the standards evaluated in the UI GreenMetric rankings.

sections.title: Contributions to the Sustainable Development Goals
content: SDG 4 – Quality Education Promotes sustainability education by integrating environmental responsibility into higher education curricula and campus initiatives. Enhances knowledge and skills of faculty and students on sustainable practices. SDG 6 – Clean Water and Sanitation Encourages effective water conservation and management practices on campuses to ensure sustainable use of water resources. SDG 7 – Affordable and Clean Energy Supports the adoption of energy-efficient technologies and renewable energy solutions in university infrastructure. SDG 11 – Sustainable Cities and Communities Advances the development of green campuses that contribute to sustainable urban environments through waste management, green buildings, and sustainable transportation. SDG 12 – Responsible Consumption and Production Promotes sustainable waste management practices, reducing waste generation and encouraging recycling and reuse within university communities. SDG 13 – Climate Action Strengthens efforts to mitigate climate change impacts by promoting energy efficiency, reducing carbon footprint, and encouraging climate-resilient infrastructure. SDG 17 – Partnerships for the Goals Fosters collaboration and knowledge exchange among universities, government bodies, and other stakeholders to accelerate progress toward sustainability.

columns.title: General Assessment
content: GreenMetric proved to be a highly valuable and timely event for universities in the Philippines, including Urdaneta City University. Conducted virtually, the workshop successfully gathered sustainability advocates, faculty, and experts from various institutions to foster a shared commitment toward environmental responsibility in higher education.

The workshop effectively increased awareness of the UI GreenMetric World University Rankings, providing participants with clear guidance on the ranking criteria and questionnaire. This helped institutions like UCU understand how to better collect and report sustainability data, thereby improving their campus environmental performance.

The focus on critical sustainability areas—such as waste management, energy efficiency, water conservation, and green building practices—provided practical insights and actionable strategies. Additionally, the workshop fostered an environment for collaboration, allowing universities to share best practices and explore partnerships that can amplify sustainability efforts.

Overall, the workshop contributed significantly to advancing the sustainability agenda in Philippine higher education institutions. It reinforced the importance of integrating sustainable development goals within campus operations and educational programs. The event also demonstrated the growing momentum and spirit among universities to collectively work towards a greener, more sustainable future.

columns.title: Recommendations
content: To build on the momentum of the 2nd National Workshop on UI GreenMetric, universities should strengthen their data collection and reporting systems to ensure accurate and consistent submission for the rankings. Expanding capacity-building programs through regular training for faculty, staff, and students will deepen the understanding of sustainability practices and encourage active participation across campus communities. It is also essential to foster collaboration among universities by creating networks for sharing best practices and jointly implementing sustainability initiatives.

Integrating sustainability more thoroughly into academic curricula will prepare environmentally conscious graduates, while leveraging technology can enhance energy efficiency, water management, and waste reduction efforts. Additionally, universities should engage with stakeholders beyond academia, including local governments and industries, to amplify the impact of their sustainability projects. Regular monitoring and evaluation of progress will help maintain focus on set goals and drive continuous improvement. Finally, raising awareness and effectively communicating achievements will sustain enthusiasm and commitment to advancing environmental responsibility on campuses.
