The ASIA Summer Program (ASP), hosted by Dongseo University in Busan, South Korea, is a multi-institution initiative designed to deepen academic cooperation and cultural exchange across Asia. In this edition, Urdaneta City University (UCU) joined a consortium of partner universities, sending students and faculty to undertake short courses in Korean culture, language, and business, while engaging in field visits and intercultural activities around Busan. A key highlight of UCU’s participation was the inclusion of its Director for External Affairs as a visiting lecturer, underscoring the university’s commitment to reciprocal knowledge sharing and reinforcing its profile within the ASP network.

sections.title: This projects aims to:
items: Strengthen international academic collaboration by integrating UCU faculty and students into a multinational learning environment at Dongseo University.
Enhance intercultural competence through immersive coursework and cultural excursions that expose participants to Korean history, business practices, and contemporary society.
Expand UCU’s academic offerings and networks by building sustainable partnerships that can lead to future joint programs, research projects, and student exchanges.

sections.title: Contributions to the Sustainable Development Goals
content: The ASIA Summer Program (ASP) at Dongseo University contributes meaningfully to several Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). It aligns with SDG 4 – Quality Education by offering high-quality and inclusive learning experiences that integrate academic rigor with real-world cultural immersion, enhancing students' global competence. The program also supports SDG 10 – Reduced Inequalities by offering scholarships and mobility opportunities that make international education accessible to students who might otherwise lack such experiences. Through meaningful cross-cultural dialogue and shared academic spaces, the program advances SDG 16 – Peace, Justice, and Strong Institutions, fostering mutual understanding, respect, and international harmony. Furthermore, SDG 17 – Partnerships for the Goals is demonstrated through the program’s collaborative teaching, shared activities, and strong inter-university networks that exemplify global cooperation in achieving sustainable educational development.

columns.title: General Assessment
content: UCU’s engagement in the ASP proved highly beneficial. Students reported improved intercultural skills, broader academic horizons, and greater confidence in cross-border collaboration. Faculty gained fresh insights into Korean pedagogical approaches and identified potential research partners. The Director’s teaching stint elevated UCU’s visibility and demonstrated its readiness to contribute expertise—not merely receive it—in international programs. Overall, the activity met its objectives of strengthening partnerships and enhancing global competence.

columns.title: Recommendations
content: To maximize the long-term impact of Urdaneta City University's participation in the ASIA Summer Program, it is recommended to formalize bilateral agreements with Dongseo University and other ASP partners to support credit transfers, joint research initiatives, and reciprocal faculty exchanges. Establishing a reintegration scheme for returning students and faculty—through seminars, curriculum enhancements, or campus-wide sharing events—can help disseminate newly acquired knowledge and experiences. To ensure inclusivity, the university should actively pursue funding opportunities such as government mobility grants or private sponsorships to enable participation from economically disadvantaged students. Additionally, integrating virtual follow-up sessions with ASP peers will help sustain collaborations beyond the program’s duration and encourage the development of joint projects. Lastly, creating a monitoring framework to track alumni outcomes, including international internships, graduate studies, and cross-cultural initiatives, will provide valuable insights into the program’s long-term effectiveness and guide future participation strategies.

Urdaneta City University’s Office of External Affairs and Linkages (EAL) undertook a benchmarking visit to De La Salle Lipa (DLSL) in Batangas as part of its continuous quality-improvement and internationalization agenda. DLSL was selected for its well-established industry partnerships, active international collaborations, and robust student-engagement programs—areas that closely align with EAL’s strategic priorities.

On arrival, the EAL delegation was welcomed by DLSL’s senior administrators, faculty leaders, and Linkages Office staff. An initial briefing provided an overview of DLSL’s vision, governance structure, and the guiding principles behind its external-relations framework. These insights set the stage for a deeper exchange of ideas on partnership cultivation and program design.

Throughout the day, the UCU team engaged in focused discussions and campus tours that highlighted DLSL’s best practices, including its internship pipelines with regional industries, faculty–industry research collaborations, and international service-learning projects. The visit underscored the shared commitment of both institutions to nurturing graduates who are globally competent and socially responsible.

sections.title: This projects aims to:
items: Identify effective strategies for building and sustaining industry partnerships that enhance graduate employability.
Examine models for international collaboration—such as exchange programs, joint research, and service-learning—that can be adapted at UCU.
Explore approaches to student engagement that integrate academic learning with community impact.
Benchmark administrative structures and digital tools that improve efficiency in managing external linkages.
Strengthen institutional ties between UCU and DLSL for future joint initiatives.

sections.title: Contributions to the Sustainable Development Goals
content: The benchmarking visit contributes to SDG 4 (Quality Education) by enabling UCU to refine academic–industry linkages and global learning opportunities that elevate educational quality. By focusing on employability and innovation, the activity aligns with SDG 8 (Decent Work and Economic Growth) and SDG 9 (Industry, Innovation and Infrastructure) through the cultivation of skills relevant to emerging industries. Finally, the collaboration between UCU and DLSL exemplifies SDG 17 (Partnerships for the Goals), demonstrating how inter-institutional cooperation accelerates progress toward shared development objectives.

columns.title: General Assessment
content: The visit effectively met its learning objectives, providing UCU with actionable insights into office structuring, partner-relationship management, and student-centered programming. DLSL’s decentralized yet coordinated approach—where dedicated teams handle industry, international, and community links under a unified digital system—proved particularly instructive.

UCU delegates noted the strength of DLSL’s industry advisory councils, which co-design internship tracks and capstone projects. This mechanism ensures curricula remain responsive to employer needs and can be adapted at UCU to enhance graduate readiness.

Challenges identified include the resource investment required to replicate DLSL’s digital infrastructure and the need to customize partnership models for UCU’s regional context. Nevertheless, the collaborative spirit displayed by DLSL signals strong potential for joint ventures that will benefit both universities.

columns.title: Recommendations
content: UCU should establish a phased plan to restructure its EAL office into specialized units—industry relations, international collaborations, and community engagement—supported by a lightweight digital tracking system. Initial efforts can leverage existing campus IT resources while exploring grants or partnerships for a full-scale portal similar to DLSL’s.

Concurrently, UCU is encouraged to pilot an industry advisory council and a service-learning credit scheme, modeled on DLSL examples, to deepen stakeholder engagement and enrich student experience. Formalizing ties with DLSL through a memorandum of understanding will pave the way for faculty exchanges, joint research, and co-hosted outreach projects that advance both institutions’ goals of academic excellence and societal impact.

The benchmarking activity between Urdaneta City University (UCU) and Don Mariano Marcos Memorial State University (DMMSU) was undertaken to strengthen UCU’s external affairs, linkages, and community engagement strategies. Recognizing the importance of continuous improvement and inter-institutional learning, UCU initiated the visit to observe best practices and adopt innovative approaches in building sustainable partnerships.

DMMSU, known for its strong community orientation and successful collaborations, served as an ideal institution for comparative analysis. The university has demonstrated effective systems in managing both local and international linkages, as well as community outreach programs that align with academic and research functions. UCU's team closely observed DMMSU’s organizational structure, operations, and use of technology in streamlining processes.

This activity also provided an opportunity for UCU to establish rapport and explore potential future collaboration with DMMSU. Through meaningful dialogue, both institutions exchanged ideas and identified shared goals, opening the door for joint initiatives in student mobility, research, and development programs.

sections.title: This projects aims:
items: To evaluate and understand DMMSU’s best practices in managing external partnerships and linkages.
To analyze and compare organizational structures for more effective office management at UCU.
To identify successful models for community outreach and student exchange programs.
To explore the integration of digital tools in tracking and managing institutional partnerships.

sections.title: Contributions to the Sustainable Development Goals
content: The benchmarking activity supports several Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs), especially SDG 4 – Quality Education, by enhancing institutional capacity to deliver inclusive, relevant, and high-quality academic partnerships. It also promotes SDG 17 – Partnerships for the Goals by encouraging collaboration between higher education institutions to exchange best practices and build stronger networks. Furthermore, the insights gained on community outreach programs contribute to SDG 11 – Sustainable Cities and Communities, while the adoption of digital tools supports SDG 9 – Industry, Innovation, and Infrastructure through the modernization of administrative processes.

columns.title: General Assessment
content: The benchmarking activity was highly valuable and timely. UCU gained practical knowledge from DMMSU’s structured systems and dynamic collaboration strategies, particularly how they aligned internal operations to support sustained partnerships. The experience helped highlight areas in UCU's current system that can be reorganized for greater efficiency.

A major takeaway was the benefit of decentralization, where specific functions were handled by dedicated units under a unified framework. DMMSU’s example demonstrated how specialization could reduce redundancy and improve responsiveness to partnership opportunities. UCU recognized the need to replicate this model to streamline its external affairs processes.

Additionally, the benchmarking exposed UCU to the critical role of digitalization in improving efficiency and transparency in managing linkages. The observed use of online platforms and automated reporting systems showcased DMMSU’s commitment to accountability and sustainability, offering UCU a viable roadmap for innovation.

columns.title: Recommendations
content: Based on the insights gained, UCU should begin refining its office structure to establish clearer roles and specialized units for handling local and international linkages, research collaborations, and community partnerships. Streamlining responsibilities and delegating tasks will enhance workflow and responsiveness. Additionally, there should be efforts to institutionalize a digital system to manage partnerships, track engagement metrics, and generate reports with ease. UCU should also initiate capacity-building programs for staff to become familiar with digital tools and partnership frameworks. Furthermore, the university should proactively pursue new collaborations by leveraging insights from DMMSU’s model and exploring joint initiatives such as student exchanges, collaborative research, and extension projects. Strengthening these partnerships will not only benefit the institution but will also contribute significantly to regional development and knowledge-sharing.

title: Fun Bahasa Indonesia and Cultural Course (FIBCC)

content: In today’s increasingly interconnected world, fostering cross-cultural understanding and international collaboration is essential for educational institutions. Recognizing this, the Office of External Affairs and Linkages actively engaged in the Fun Bahasa Indonesia and Cultural Course (FBICC), a program designed to promote cultural exchange and language learning.

The FBICC aimed to introduce participants to the rich language and vibrant culture of Indonesia through interactive lessons and hands-on cultural workshops. By participating in and coordinating this event, the office sought to strengthen ties between the institution and Indonesian cultural organizations, enhancing mutual understanding and cooperation. This initiative aligns with the institution’s broader mission to cultivate meaningful international linkages and provide diverse, enriching learning opportunities for its community.

sections.title: This projects aims:
items: To promote cultural exchange by introducing participants to the Indonesian language and culture.
To enhance language learning through interactive lessons focused on Bahasa Indonesia.
To provide engaging cultural workshops that explore traditional Indonesian music, dance, and cuisine.
To strengthen connections and foster collaboration between the institution and Indonesian cultural organizations.

sections.title: Contributions to the Sustainable Development Goals
content: The program contributes significantly to several Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). It supports SDG 4 – Quality Education by promoting language learning and cultural education, which fosters inclusive and equitable access to quality education while enhancing skills and knowledge for lifelong learning. Additionally, the cultural exchange initiative advances SDG 10 – Reduced Inequalities by encouraging greater understanding and respect among diverse communities, thereby helping to reduce social disparities and promote cohesion. Through the promotion of cross-cultural dialogue and international collaboration, the program also aligns with SDG 16 – Peace, Justice, and Strong Institutions, contributing to the development of peaceful, inclusive societies and the strengthening of institutional partnerships. Finally, the collaboration between the institution and Indonesian cultural organizations exemplifies SDG 17 – Partnerships for the Goals, demonstrating how global partnerships in culture and education can effectively advance sustainable development.

columns.title: General Assessment
content: The Fun Bahasa Indonesia and Cultural Course (FBICC) proved to be a successful and impactful program in promoting cultural exchange and language learning. The active involvement of the Office of External Affairs and Linkages was instrumental in ensuring smooth coordination and broad participation. The interactive language lessons effectively introduced participants to the basics of Bahasa Indonesia, while the cultural workshops provided a well-rounded understanding of Indonesia’s traditional music, dance, and cuisine. This combination of language and culture fostered an engaging and immersive learning environment.

The activity not only enriched participants’ appreciation of Indonesian culture but also strengthened the institution’s connections with Indonesian cultural organizations, opening avenues for future collaborations. Moreover, the program aligned well with the institution’s mission to enhance international linkages and provide diverse educational experiences. Overall, FBICC contributed positively to fostering cultural awareness and global competence among the university community, highlighting the value of such cross-cultural initiatives in higher education.

columns.title: Recommendations
content: To build on the success of the Fun Bahasa Indonesia and Cultural Course (FBICC), it is recommended that the institution continue to support and expand similar cultural exchange programs that promote language learning and intercultural understanding. Future activities could incorporate more advanced language modules and deeper cultural explorations to engage participants at various proficiency levels. Strengthening partnerships with Indonesian cultural organizations can help enrich the content and provide authentic experiences. Additionally, integrating these cultural programs into the broader curriculum or extracurricular offerings could enhance participation and sustainability. Finally, conducting regular feedback and assessment sessions will help tailor future programs to better meet the needs and interests of the university community, ensuring ongoing relevance and impact.

The Office of External Affairs and Linkages recently hosted the Globalize Rank Internationalization Mastery Training, a strategic initiative aimed at strengthening the university’s capacity for global engagement and enhancing its position in the international academic community. In today’s rapidly evolving higher education landscape, universities are increasingly expected to operate beyond national borders, engaging in diverse forms of collaboration and exchange. Recognizing this, the university sought to prepare its faculty and staff to effectively navigate and contribute to this complex environment. The training was designed to provide comprehensive insights into the global higher education ecosystem, equipping participants with the knowledge and skills needed to respond to emerging challenges and opportunities in academic internationalization.

sections.title: This projects aims to:
items: Develop practical strategies for establishing and nurturing sustainable international partnerships
Emphasize the importance of student mobility programs
Deepen participants’ understanding of prevailing global trends in higher education

sections.title: Contributions to the Sustainable Development Goals
content: The training made significant contributions toward advancing several United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). Primarily, it supported SDG 4 (Quality Education) by promoting access to inclusive and equitable quality education through international academic exchanges and partnerships. This fosters an environment where students and faculty can benefit from diverse perspectives and shared expertise. The activity also aligned with SDG 10 (Reduced Inequalities) by encouraging the development of global networks that help bridge educational gaps between countries and communities. Moreover, the training reinforced SDG 17 (Partnerships for the Goals) by highlighting the critical role of international cooperation in achieving sustainable development, fostering institutional alliances that can generate impactful research and knowledge sharing for societal benefit.

columns.title: General Assessment
content: The overall reception of the training was highly positive. Participants appreciated the depth and relevance of the content, as well as the expertise of the facilitator. Many expressed that the training significantly enhanced their understanding of internationalization and equipped them with actionable tools to contribute to the university’s global strategies. There was a palpable sense of enthusiasm and readiness to apply the learning in their respective roles. Nonetheless, the training also revealed areas needing further attention, such as the necessity for ongoing professional development, better coordination among university units involved in internationalization, and more resources to support expansive and sustained global initiatives.

columns.title: Recommendations
content: Building on the success of this training, it is recommended that the university establish a continuous professional development program that offers periodic refresher courses and advanced workshops on internationalization topics. Forming a dedicated task force or committee to coordinate and monitor internationalization activities would ensure consistent implementation and alignment with institutional goals. Additionally, the development of a robust monitoring and evaluation framework is essential to track the effectiveness of international programs and partnerships, allowing for data-driven adjustments and improvements. Encouraging greater collaboration among academic departments, administrative offices, and external partners will also be vital in sustaining momentum. Finally, increasing awareness and engagement among a broader range of faculty and staff will help embed internationalization deeply into the university’s culture, ultimately enhancing its global reputation and impact.

Held entirely online, HR International: International Education Cultural Exchange Programs convened educators, researchers, and students from universities across multiple continents. The initiative was conceived as a response to the growing demand for virtual platforms that can sustain academic collaboration and cultural dialogue when physical mobility is limited.

For JCU, the program represented both a continuation and an expansion of its internationalization agenda. By engaging alongside long-standing partners and new contacts, the university reaffirmed its commitment to global networking while exploring fresh avenues for joint teaching, research, and student mobility.

sections.title: This projects aims to:
items: Strengthen existing international partnerships and establish new collaborative links.
Exchange best practices and emerging trends in global higher education and cultural exchange.
Provide virtual international exposure for faculty and students constrained by travel limitations.
Identify concrete opportunities for joint projects, short courses, or research initiatives.
Foster intercultural understanding and dialogue despite geographic and time-zone barriers.

sections.title: Contributions to the Sustainable Development Goals
content: The program advanced SDG 4 – Quality Education by creating an inclusive, global learning space that broadened participants’ academic perspectives. It supported SDG 10 – Reduced Inequalities by offering cost-effective international engagement to individuals who might lack resources for overseas study. Through sustained intercultural dialogue, it aligned with SDG 16 – Peace, Justice, and Strong Institutions, nurturing mutual respect and cooperation among diverse institutions. Finally, by uniting universities, professional bodies, and learners around shared goals, the event exemplified SDG 17 – Partnerships for the Goals, reinforcing the idea that global challenges in education are best addressed through coordinated action.

columns.title: General Assessment
content: Overall, the event successfully met its goals. Participants reported broader awareness of international education trends and identified actionable collaboration prospects. JCU’s representatives strengthened ties with long-standing partners and initiated discussions for co-developed micro-credential courses. Although time-zone differences limited real-time participation for some sessions, recordings and discussion boards mitigated this challenge and maintained engagement.

columns.title: Recommendations
content: To build on these gains, JCU should develop a follow-up timeline that converts initial conversations into formal project agreements within six months. Investing in a shared digital workspace (e.g., a collaboration hub) would streamline joint planning and document exchange. Offering faculty micro-grants can incentivize pilot projects arising from the forum, while scheduled “virtual office hours” with partners will maintain momentum. Finally, collecting post-event metrics—such as new MOUs signed, joint papers submitted, or students enrolled in shared courses—will help track impact and guide improvements for future editions.

University rankings have become a crucial tool for benchmarking institutional performance, reputation, and global visibility. In particular, the Times Higher Education (THE) Impact Rankings have gained importance for measuring universities’ contributions to the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). These rankings assess institutions based not only on academic excellence but also on their social, environmental, and economic impact.

To strengthen its performance and align institutional strategies with the global SDG agenda, the Office of External Affairs and Linkages participated in the Online Impact Rankings Masterclass. The training provided insights into methodology, data gathering, strategy alignment, and best practices from globally ranked universities.

sections.title: This projects aims:
items: To understand the methodologies and criteria used in global impact rankings, especially the THE Impact Rankings.
To equip university stakeholders with strategies to effectively align institutional initiatives with SDG indicators.
To identify key performance areas where the university can improve in terms of social and environmental impact.
To establish a roadmap for enhancing data collection, documentation, and reporting aligned with global standards.
To foster inter-office collaboration in supporting the university's vision of global engagement and sustainable development.

sections.title: Contributions to the Sustainable Development Goals
content: By participating in the masterclass, the university contributes to several Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). It supports SDG 4: Quality Education by engaging in capacity-building initiatives and aligning both academic and administrative efforts to advance education-related indicators. The university also promotes SDG 17: Partnerships for the Goals by strengthening collaborations and forming strategic linkages aimed at enhancing SDG reporting and overall impact. In alignment with SDG 13: Climate Action, the masterclass enables the institution to gain insights into environmental impact indicators that influence global ranking metrics. Furthermore, the university advances SDG 5: Gender Equality and SDG 10: Reduced Inequalities by integrating inclusivity and equity into its institutional strategies as key areas of measurable impact.

columns.title: General Assessment
content: The masterclass proved to be highly beneficial, providing practical knowledge and strategic direction that the university can leverage to enhance its performance in global university impact rankings. Participants developed a clearer understanding of how institutional practices align with global development frameworks, as well as the critical role of robust documentation and cross-functional collaboration. Moreover, the activity significantly strengthened the capacity of the Office of External Affairs and Linkages to spearhead initiatives that promote sustainability, global competitiveness, and institutional excellence.

columns.title: Recommendations
content: To strengthen the university’s engagement with the Impact Rankings and advance its contribution to the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs), several strategic actions are recommended. First, establish an SDG Monitoring Committee responsible for collecting, validating, and reporting data related to the Impact Rankings. This committee will ensure accuracy, consistency, and timeliness in data submission. Second, conduct internal workshops for academic and administrative units to cascade the knowledge gained from relevant trainings and masterclasses, fostering a shared understanding and alignment of efforts across the institution. Third, develop an SDG-aligned strategic plan that incorporates measurable indicators directly linked to ranking participation, enabling clear tracking of progress. Fourth, enhance inter-departmental coordination to facilitate integrated reporting and ensure that all relevant contributions are captured comprehensively. Lastly, invest in digital tools to support efficient data management and reporting in accordance with international ranking standards, thereby improving the university’s capacity to showcase its impact on global development goals.

Urdaneta City University (UCU) conducted a benchmarking activity at Mariano Marcos State University (MMSU) to strengthen its External Affairs and Linkages programs. As part of UCU's commitment to continuous improvement and internationalization, the visit aimed to explore MMSU's systems and strategies that have led to successful academic and community partnerships. MMSU was identified as a model institution due to its strong track record in establishing and sustaining both local and global collaborations.

During the visit, the UCU delegation engaged in structured dialogues with MMSU officials and staff, observing key functions of their External Affairs and Linkages office. The benchmarking focused on MMSU’s organizational setup, their partnership development process, and the outcomes of their collaborations. The team also reviewed MMSU’s digital tools for monitoring partnerships and community extension projects.

This experience provided UCU with practical insights that could be adapted to improve internal systems, promote strategic partnerships, and support the university’s mission of delivering impactful academic and community programs. The benchmarking activity underscored the importance of institutional readiness and proactive engagement in building sustainable partnerships.

sections.title: This projects aims:
items: To analyze MMSU's best practices in managing external affairs and linkages.
To understand the role of organizational structure in successful partnerships.
To examine how digital systems can enhance efficiency in partnership management.
To explore effective strategies for local and international collaborations.
To identify community engagement models that can be replicated at UCU.

sections.title: Contributions to the Sustainable Development Goals
content: The benchmarking activity contributed to multiple Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). Primarily, it supported SDG 4 – Quality Education by exploring models of academic partnerships that enhance educational delivery and access. It also aligned with SDG 17 – Partnerships for the Goals, fostering institutional cooperation for sustainable development. The emphasis on digital innovation addressed SDG 9 – Industry, Innovation and Infrastructure, while MMSU’s strong community outreach programs were relevant to SDG 11 – Sustainable Cities and Communities, showcasing how universities can serve as engines of regional transformation.

columns.title: General Assessment
content: The benchmarking activity was highly insightful and productive. UCU gained a comprehensive understanding of how MMSU has institutionalized external affairs through strategic planning, structured operations, and responsive leadership. The clarity of roles and responsibilities within MMSU’s External Affairs Office demonstrated how effective management supports long-term collaboration.

MMSU's success in international partnerships was also noted as a significant learning point. The integration of research, teaching, and community service into these partnerships showed the value of a holistic approach to engagement. UCU can benefit from adopting similar alignment strategies to enhance the relevance and impact of its external programs.

Furthermore, the application of digital solutions at MMSU was exemplary. UCU recognized the advantages of adopting technology to automate reporting, monitor progress, and facilitate real-time coordination with partners. These tools not only improve efficiency but also enhance transparency and accountability.

columns.title: Recommendations
content: UCU should consider revising its External Affairs and Linkages office structure to promote greater specialization and clarity of roles. Establishing distinct units for local and international affairs, research partnerships, and community engagement may help streamline functions and boost overall performance. In addition, developing digital tools for tracking partnerships, engagement outcomes, and reporting will greatly enhance operational efficiency.

It is also recommended that UCU prioritize expanding both local and global collaborations by leveraging lessons learned from MMSU. Launching new outreach programs, engaging with strategic partners, and exploring co-developed academic initiatives can strengthen UCU’s reputation and reach. Through these steps, UCU can position itself as a forward-thinking institution capable of sustaining impactful partnerships and regional development.

title: National Public Consultation on the proposed Policies and Guidelines for Open Distance and Learning

content: The National Public Consultation on the proposed Policies and Guidelines for Open Distance and Learning (ODL), convened in Tagaytay, gathered key education stakeholders to refine a nationwide framework that will ensure quality, accessibility, and equity in ODL programs. Responding to the surge in remote-learning demand—accelerated by the pandemic and the growing need for flexible education pathways—the consultation was organized by national education authorities to harmonize institutional practices and regulatory standards. Urdaneta City University’s Office of External Affairs and Linkages (OEA&L) joined policy makers, educators, industry leaders, and technologists to contribute evidence-based insights drawn from the university’s own distance-learning initiatives.

sections.title: This projects aims to:
items: Solicit multi-stakeholder feedback on the draft ODL policies to ensure they are practical, inclusive, and responsive to diverse learner contexts.
Identify quality benchmarks for curriculum design, instructional delivery, assessment, and learner support in virtual and blended environments.
Promote equitable access by addressing infrastructure gaps and proposing measures to reach underserved and remote populations.
Align institutional practices with national standards, enabling seamless credit transfer, accreditation, and lifelong-learning pathways.
Strengthen collaboration among higher-education institutions, government agencies, and industry partners for continuous ODL improvement.

sections.title: Contributions to the Sustainable Development Goals
content: The National Public Consultation on the proposed Policies and Guidelines for Open Distance and Learning contributes significantly to several Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). It directly supports SDG 4 – Quality Education by fostering policies that ensure inclusive, equitable, and high-quality education through flexible ODL modalities. The emphasis on strengthening digital platforms and incorporating innovative learning technologies aligns with SDG 9 – Industry, Innovation and Infrastructure, as it promotes the development of resilient and future-ready educational systems. Moreover, the ODL framework plays a crucial role in addressing SDG 10 – Reduced Inequalities by lowering geographic and economic barriers, thus providing expanded learning opportunities for marginalized and remote communities. Finally, the consultation exemplifies SDG 17 – Partnerships for the Goals, as it brings together universities, government bodies, and private sector stakeholders in a collaborative effort to shape effective and inclusive national education policies.

columns.title: General Assessment
content: The consultation proved highly productive. OEA&L effectively voiced the university’s perspective, earning commendations for its practical suggestions on learner engagement metrics. Stakeholder consensus emerged on minimum quality standards and the need for tiered compliance timelines, reflecting realistic institutional capacities. The inclusive dialogue enhanced goodwill among participants and positioned UCU as a proactive contributor to national ODL policy development.

columns.title: Recommendations
content: To further support the development and implementation of effective Open Distance Learning (ODL) policies, it is recommended that Urdaneta City University maintain active involvement in future drafting rounds and public hearings to ensure its unique context and pilot data continue to inform national guidelines. The university should also establish an internal ODL task force focused on aligning curriculum design, faculty training, and IT infrastructure with upcoming standards. In addition, piloting equity-focused initiatives—such as low-bandwidth course packs and community learning hubs—will demonstrate best practices in reaching underserved learners. To strengthen digital access and platform reliability, forging partnerships with educational technology firms and telecommunications providers is essential. Finally, the university should implement a comprehensive monitoring framework that tracks key indicators such as completion rates, learner satisfaction, and accessibility to assess the impact of new policies and guide continuous improvement efforts.

The External Affairs and Linkages Office of Urdaneta City University (UCU) participated in the PUNP Information Session held at Panpacific University as part of its ongoing commitment to fostering strategic academic partnerships. The session served as a platform to explore potential areas of collaboration, including joint research initiatives, faculty exchanges, and student internship programs. It also facilitated discussions on the development of joint academic offerings and the sharing of best practices between institutions. This engagement not only reinforced UCU’s relationship with Panpacific University but also aligned with its broader goal of expanding its global academic network. The session concluded successfully, laying a strong foundation for future collaborative endeavors.

sections.title: This projects aims:

To initiate discussions on the development of joint academic programs that will enhance the academic offerings of both institutions.
To share best practices in teaching, research, and university management for mutual growth and innovation.
To strengthen institutional partnerships and build a network of academic linkages that support internationalization goals.

sections.title: Contributions to the Sustainable Development Goals
content: The participation of Urdaneta City University (UCU) in the PUNP Information Session contributes significantly to several Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs), particularly SDG 4 (Quality Education), SDG 17 (Partnerships for the Goals), and SDG 9 (Industry, Innovation, and Infrastructure). By fostering collaborations in research, faculty exchanges, and student internships, the activity supports the enhancement of educational quality and access to learning opportunities beyond institutional borders. The discussions on joint academic programs and best practices promote innovative approaches to education and institutional development. Furthermore, the strengthening of partnerships aligns with the global call for cooperative efforts in achieving sustainable development, showcasing UCU’s active role in building inclusive, resilient, and globally connected educational institutions.

columns.title: General Assessment
content: The participation of Urdaneta City University in the PUNP Information Session was highly successful and productive. The activity effectively met its objectives by opening channels for future collaboration and establishing a solid foundation for academic partnerships. The discussions were meaningful and forward-looking, highlighting shared goals in enhancing education through research, faculty development, and student engagement. The positive reception and active involvement of both institutions reflect a strong mutual commitment to academic excellence and innovation. Overall, the engagement not only strengthened institutional ties but also positioned UCU to further its vision of becoming a globally connected and development-oriented university.

columns.title: Recommendations
content: It is recommended that Urdaneta City University continue to pursue and formalize the collaborative opportunities discussed during the PUNP Information Session. Establishing a memorandum of understanding (MOU) or partnership agreement with Panpacific University would provide a clear framework for implementing joint research projects, faculty exchanges, student internships, and academic program development. Regular follow-up meetings and collaborative planning sessions should also be scheduled to sustain momentum and ensure progress. Additionally, expanding similar engagements with other institutions will further support UCU’s internationalization goals and strengthen its position as a dynamic and globally engaged university.

title: Region 1 2024 Higher Education Executive Conference at Monarch Hotel Calasiao

content: The Region 1 2024 Higher Education Executive Conference, held at the Monarch Hotel in Calasiao, served as a strategic platform for higher education leaders and stakeholders to convene and collaborate. The event aimed to foster dialogue on current issues, emerging trends, and innovative practices shaping the academic landscape. With active participation from executives, administrators, and representatives of various institutions, the conference focused on strengthening partnerships and enhancing the quality of higher education in the region.

The Office of External Affairs and Linkages actively participated in the conference, reaffirming its commitment to academic collaboration and institutional advancement. Through engagement in the sessions and networking activities, the office gained valuable insights into best practices and policy directions that are vital for institutional growth and regional academic development.

sections.title: This projects aims:
items: To bring together higher education executives and stakeholders in Region for collaborative discussions on pressing issues, trends, and innovations in the academic sector.
To explore policy directions and strategic initiatives that enhance institutional development and academic excellence.
To strengthen partnerships and linkages among higher education institutions, government agencies, and other key sectors.
To share best practices and success stories that promote innovation, inclusivity, and sustainability in higher education.
To align regional higher education strategies with national and global standards through collaborative planning and dialogue.

sections.title: Contributions to the Sustainable Development Goals
content: The Region 1 2024 Higher Education Executive Conference made significant contributions to the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) by promoting collaboration, innovation, and strategic dialogue among higher education stakeholders. Primarily, it supported SDG 4: Quality Education by addressing key issues and emerging trends that affect the delivery of inclusive and equitable education. The event also strengthened SDG 17: Partnerships for the Goals through the establishment and reinforcement of networks and linkages among institutions, fostering collective efforts toward shared academic and developmental goals. In line with SDG 9: Industry, Innovation, and Infrastructure, the conference highlighted the role of innovation and technological advancement in enhancing educational systems and institutional operations. Additionally, the promotion of inclusive participation and gender-responsive policies aligned with SDG 5: Gender Equality, ensuring that higher education leadership and decision-making processes remain equitable. Lastly, the conference supported SDG 16: Peace, Justice, and Strong Institutions by advocating for ethical governance, institutional transparency, and accountable leadership in the academic sector.

columns.title: General Assessment
content: The participation of the Office of External Affairs and Linkages in the Region 1 2024 Higher Education Executive Conference was highly effective and impactful. By actively engaging in sessions, discussions, and networking opportunities, the office successfully represented the institution and reinforced its commitment to building strong external partnerships. The event served as a valuable platform for exchanging ideas, exploring collaborative opportunities, and aligning institutional goals with current trends and best practices in higher education.

Moreover, the insights gained from the conference are expected to significantly inform and enhance the university’s future external relations strategies. Overall, the activity achieved its intended objectives and contributed to both the institutional advancement and the broader goals of academic collaboration and innovation in the region.

columns.title: Recommendations
content: To maximize the benefits gained from participating in the Region 1 2024 Higher Education Executive Conference, it is recommended that the Office of External Affairs and Linkages sustain its active involvement in regional and national conferences. Continued participation will help maintain institutional visibility, foster new partnerships, and keep the university informed of the latest trends and developments in higher education. It is also advisable to share key insights from the conference through internal briefings or knowledge-sharing sessions to ensure that relevant stakeholders benefit from the learnings. Moreover, the office should explore potential collaborative projects, such as joint programs, research initiatives, or academic exchanges with institutions encountered during the event. Incorporating these insights into the university’s strategic planning processes will enhance the relevance and effectiveness of external relations efforts. Additionally, improving the documentation and evaluation of conference participation will help track its impact on institutional goals. Lastly, involving representatives from other departments in future conferences is encouraged to promote interdisciplinary collaboration and strengthen the university’s overall engagement and presence.

The Office of External Affairs and Linkages actively participated in the TIMPUYOG: 2024 ASEAN Conference for Region 1 Higher Education Institutions held at Virgen Milagrosa University Foundation. This landmark event brought together representatives from various HEIs across the region, serving as a dynamic platform for dialogue, collaboration, and the advancement of internationalization efforts within the ASEAN educational community.

The conference featured a series of informative presentations, interactive workshops, and strategic networking sessions centered on key themes such as student mobility, faculty exchange, joint research initiatives, and community engagement. These discussions highlighted best practices, emerging trends, and potential partnerships that align with the goals of higher education institutions in the ASEAN region.

Through its active engagement, the Office of External Affairs and Linkages effectively represented the university, contributing to knowledge exchange and fostering meaningful connections with peer institutions. The insights and linkages gained from the conference are expected to significantly enhance the university’s internationalization agenda and strengthen its role in regional academic cooperation.

The Office of External Affairs and Linkages actively participated in the U.S. Embassy Visit held at the Audio-Visual Room (AVR) of Urdaneta City University. The External Affairs and Linkages Office of Urdaneta City University (UCU) has played a pivotal role in advancing the university's global visibility and reputation by successfully facilitating UCU’s participation in the Times Higher Education (THE) Rankings. THE is a globally recognized benchmarking system that evaluates universities based on comprehensive performance indicators, including teaching quality, research output, knowledge transfer, and international outlook.

This achievement was made possible through the office’s strategic coordination with various academic and administrative units across the university. The process involved the meticulous collection, validation, and submission of data aligned with THE’s rigorous standards. Key aspects highlighted in the submission included UCU’s academic excellence, impactful research contributions, strong industry linkages, and active community engagement.

By ensuring compliance with THE's stringent requirements, the External Affairs and Linkages Office underscored UCU’s commitment to global competitiveness and institutional excellence. This milestone marks a significant step in the university’s ongoing efforts toward internationalization and educational development.

sections.title: This projects aims:
items: To facilitate UCU’s official participation in the Times Higher Education (THE) Rankings by coordinating and overseeing the data gathering, validation, and submission processes in accordance with THE’s established criteria.

To strengthen interdepartmental collaboration among academic and administrative units in the collection and documentation of relevant institutional data on teaching, research, knowledge transfer, and international engagement.
To promote UCU’s academic and research excellence through the strategic presentation of the university’s achievements, outputs, and partnerships on an internationally recognized platform.

sections.title: Contributions to the Sustainable Development Goals
content: The participation of Urdaneta City University (UCU) in the Times Higher Education (THE) Rankings, facilitated by the External Affairs and Linkages Office, directly supports several United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). By highlighting the university’s achievements in quality education (SDG 4), the initiative emphasizes UCU’s commitment to providing accessible, inclusive, and high-standard learning opportunities. The documentation of research outputs and community engagement activities contributes to goals such as decent work and economic growth (SDG 9, industry, innovation, and infrastructure (SDG 9), and reduced inequalities (SDG 10). Furthermore, the university’s partnerships with local and international stakeholders align with SDG 17 (Partnerships for the Goals), fostering collaboration for sustainable and equitable development. Overall, this milestone not only enhances UCU’s global standing but also reaffirms its role as a key contributor to national and international development efforts.

columns.title: General Assessment
content: The facilitation of Urdaneta City University’s participation in the Times Higher Education (THE) World University Rankings by the External Affairs and Linkages Office represents a significant achievement in the university’s pursuit of international recognition and institutional advancement. The activity was effectively planned, systematically executed, and demonstrated strong interdepartmental collaboration. The comprehensive data gathering and validation process reflected the university’s commitment to accuracy, transparency, and excellence. By successfully complying with THE’s rigorous standards, UCU has positioned itself as a globally competitive institution with a clear focus on academic quality, research impact, industry engagement, and internationalization. Overall, the initiative not only elevated UCU’s global profile but also fostered a culture of continuous improvement and strategic alignment with global higher education standards.

columns.title: Recommendations
content: To build on the successful facilitation of Urdaneta City University's participation in the Times Higher Education (THE) Rankings, it is recommended that the External Affairs and Linkages Office continue fostering strong collaboration with academic and administrative units to ensure sustained efficiency in future ranking initiatives. Establishing a centralized and regularly updated data repository would streamline future submissions by providing quick access to accurate institutional information. Institutionalizing the ranking process through formal policies, clear timelines, and defined responsibilities should be considered to align this effort with the university’s long-term strategic planning. Increasing awareness and involvement among faculty and staff through regular orientation and capacity-building activities will also strengthen institutional engagement and performance. Additionally, UCU should invest further in research development and internationalization efforts, such as faculty publications, academic partnerships, and student exchange programs, to enhance its standing in global benchmarks. Finally, conducting post-submission evaluations after each ranking cycle will help identify strengths, address gaps, and inform continuous improvement. These actions will reinforce UCU’s commitment to excellence and global competitiveness.

The UNESCO Futures Education and Research Network (FERN) convened the Journal of Philippine Futures Studies Online Forum as part of its broader mandate to cultivate futures literacy and scenario thinking among scholars, policymakers, and civil-society actors. Recognizing the accelerating pace of social, technological, and environmental change, FERN positions future studies as a vital discipline for imagining alternative pathways and anticipating long-term challenges. By bringing together experts in foresight, sociology, economics, and environmental science, the forum aimed to generate evidence-based narratives about possible Philippine futures to inform strategic planning and policy innovation.

For Urdaneta City University (UCU), participation aligned with its strategic thrust of embedding foresight into institutional research and community-engagement activities. The Office of External Affairs and Linkages (OEA&L) viewed the event as an opportunity to benchmark its own futures initiatives, deepen faculty familiarity with emerging methodologies, and network with leading practitioners in the field.

The virtual format—necessitated by geographic dispersion and cost considerations—allowed wider national representation, including researchers from Mindanao, Visayas, and Luzon. Interactive digital tools enabled real-time polling, collaborative scenario mapping, and breakout dialogues, ensuring that geographic distance did not diminish the richness of scholarly exchange.

sections.title: This projects aims to:
items: Deepen institutional expertise in futures studies methodologies (e.g., scenario building, horizon scanning, Delphi analysis).
Identify emerging socio-economic and technological trends pertinent to the Philippines and the Ilocos Region for incorporation into UCU’s research agenda.
Forge collaborative relationships with futures scholars and institutions to co-develop research projects, policy briefs, and curricular modules.

sections.title: Contributions to the Sustainable Development Goals
content: UCU’s engagement in the UNESCO FERN forum directly supported SDG 4 – Quality Education by enhancing faculty and staff competence in futures literacy, thereby enriching teaching and research. Through forward-looking analyses that address inequality, climate resilience, and inclusive growth, the activity indirectly advances SDG 10 – Reduced Inequalities and SDG 13 – Climate Action, equipping participants with tools to craft equitable, low-carbon development scenarios. Furthermore, the collaborative nature of the forum embodied SDG 17 – Partnerships for the Goals, fostering a national network of universities and research centers committed to evidence-based policy foresight.

columns.title: General Assessment
content: Overall, the forum met its objectives of enhancing futures literacy and promoting scholarly collaboration. UCU delegates reported a clearer grasp of scenario-building tools and identified concrete applications for institutional research planning. They valued the diversity of disciplinary perspectives, noting that economic, sociological, and environmental lenses enriched debate and mitigated disciplinary blind spots.

In terms of trend identification, the sessions underscored the urgency of addressing digital divides, youth unemployment, and climate-induced migration—variables that will inform UCU’s forthcoming strategic-planning cycle. The interactive digital environment was largely seamless; minor connectivity glitches were mitigated by asynchronous recording access and downloadable workshop materials.

Perhaps most notably, the forum elevated UCU’s profile within the national futures-studies community. The Office of External Affairs and Linkages emerged as an active contributor rather than a passive observer, positioning the university to lead or co-lead future foresight initiatives that serve both academia and regional stakeholders.

columns.title: Recommendations
content: To capitalize on momentum, UCU should establish an internal Futures Studies Working Group tasked with integrating scenario thinking into curriculum design, research proposals, and community-extension projects. This group can pilot short courses or micro-credentials on futures literacy for faculty, students, and local government partners, leveraging materials acquired from the forum.

Concurrently, OEA&L should formalize collaborative intents via memoranda of understanding with key forum partners, identifying shared research themes (e.g., climate resilience, digital skilling) and joint funding opportunities (such as DOST-PCIEERD grants or UNESCO participation programs). Tracking outputs—publications, policy briefs, or co-hosted events—over a three-year horizon will help gauge impact and justify continued investment in futures-oriented collaboration.

Virtual CommTECH Nusantara 2024, organized by Institut Teknologi Sepuluh Nopember (ITS) in Surabaya, Indonesia, was conceived as an online counterpart to ITS’s long-running Community and Technological (CommTECH) program. While earlier editions relied on in-person immersion, the virtual format was designed to keep intercultural engagement thriving despite travel constraints. Leveraging interactive platforms and multimedia content, the event opened Indonesian heritage, cuisine, and storytelling to a broad international audience without geographic barriers.

For Urdaneta City University’s Office of External Affairs and Linkages, participation aligned squarely with its mandate to expand global engagement and cultivate cultural literacy among staff and faculty. By joining the program, the office sought to deepen institutional ties with Indonesian partners and gather new models for virtual internationalization that could be replicated on campus.

The 2024 edition featured a thematic focus on “Nusantara”—the Indonesian archipelago’s pluralistic identity—showcasing regional diversity through architecture, gastronomy, and folklore. This provided an ideal context for UCU representatives to experience firsthand how technology can be harnessed to recreate immersive cultural encounters and to draw lessons for future online outreach initiatives.

sections.title: This projects aims to:
items: Immerse participants in Indonesian cultural heritage through virtual tours, culinary workshops, and storytelling sessions.
Strengthen institutional partnerships with ITS and other Southeast Asian universities by engaging in shared cultural programming.
Gather best practices in virtual cultural exchange to inform UCU’s own internationalization strategies.

sections.title: Contributions to the Sustainable Development Goals
content: Virtual CommTECH Nusantara 2024 advanced SDG 4 – Quality Education by providing accessible, high-quality cultural learning experiences that transcend physical borders. Its emphasis on inclusive participation and low-cost online access aligned with SDG 10 – Reduced Inequalities, enabling individuals from diverse socioeconomic backgrounds to engage in international exchange. By promoting mutual understanding and respect among participants from multiple countries, the program contributed to SDG 16 – Peace, Justice, and Strong Institutions, nurturing a culture of peace through intercultural dialogue. Finally, the collaboration between ITS, UCU, and other partner institutions embodied SDG 17 – Partnerships for the Goals, illustrating how cross-border cooperation can drive sustainable development through education and cultural diplomacy.

columns.title: General Assessment
content: Overall, the Office of External Affairs and Linkages regarded the virtual program as highly successful in meeting its cultural immersion objectives. Staff reported heightened appreciation for Indonesia’s pluralistic heritage and praised the interactive design, which kept engagement levels high despite the screen-based format.

From a partnership perspective, the event reinforced existing ties with ITS and opened channels with new Southeast Asian institutions that expressed interest in co-developing virtual exchange modules. These relationships are expected to translate into concrete projects, such as guest-lecture swaps and joint cultural showcases in the coming academic year.

Challenges were comparatively minor: occasional bandwidth issues caused brief lags during the 360-degree tour, and time-zone differences limited live participation for some segments. However, the provision of recordings and asynchronous discussion boards effectively mitigated these obstacles, ensuring that learning outcomes remained intact.

columns.title: Recommendations
content: First, UCU should build on the momentum by co-hosting a reciprocal virtual showcase that highlights Philippine cultural heritage, thereby cementing two-way engagement and providing UCU students with comparable hosting experience. Concurrently, the university can pilot a short online elective that integrates Indonesian cultural modules into relevant courses (e.g., Asian Studies, Hospitality Management), leveraging content developed through CommTECH.

Second, to sustain partnerships and monitor impact, the Office of External Affairs and Linkages should establish a joint working group with ITS to map out future collaborative activities, explore funding opportunities (e.g., ASEAN mobility grants), and create metrics—such as participant satisfaction, follow-up projects launched, and cross-cultural competencies gained—to evaluate the long-term effectiveness of virtual cultural exchanges.

The Office of External Affairs and Linkages actively participated in the 2024 World University Rankings for Innovation (WURI) Webinar, a key event aimed at enhancing understanding of how universities are evaluated for their innovation and societal impact. WURI emphasizes non-traditional indicators such as real-world problem-solving, entrepreneurial spirit, and social contributions rather than conventional academic metrics.

Through this webinar, participants, including representatives from the university, gained a comprehensive understanding of the WURI framework and assessment criteria. The session highlighted the importance of aligning institutional strategies with innovation-driven research and meaningful community engagement to enhance global competitiveness.

Moreover, the event served as a platform for exchanging insights with experts and peers from other higher education institutions. Discussions centered on best practices for strengthening innovation ecosystems within universities and ensuring that academic activities are responsive to evolving societal needs.

The knowledge and connections gained from this webinar are expected to guide the university’s strategic efforts in improving its future WURI rankings and reinforcing its role as a socially engaged and innovation-oriented institution.

sections.title: This projects aims:
items: To understand the WURI ranking framework and evaluation criteria
To identify strategies for improving the university’s standing in future WURI rankings
To explore opportunities for aligning academic initiatives with societal needs

sections.title: Contributions to the Sustainable Development Goals
content: The webinar advanced SDG 4 – Quality Education by promoting innovative and inclusive educational approaches that encourage universities to move beyond traditional metrics and focus on impactful, real-world learning, supporting the development of education systems that are relevant, practical, and socially responsive. It also aligned with SDG 9 – Industry, Innovation, and Infrastructure by emphasizing research-driven solutions and institutional innovation to build resilient infrastructures and foster innovation within higher education. Additionally, the discussions underscored SDG 11 – Sustainable Cities and Communities, highlighting the role of universities in community engagement and contributing to sustainable, inclusive community development through research and innovation. Furthermore, the event facilitated global networking and collaboration, advancing SDG 17 – Partnerships for the Goals by supporting partnerships that drive progress toward the SDGs through knowledge exchange and collective innovation.

columns.title: General Assessment
content: The WURI Webinar proved to be a highly informative and valuable activity that aligned well with the university’s strategic goals in promoting innovation and social impact. Participation in the event allowed representatives from the Office of External Affairs and Linkages to gain a deeper understanding of the WURI evaluation framework and the key indicators used to assess innovative practices in higher education. The content presented was relevant and timely, highlighting the growing global emphasis on universities' roles in addressing societal challenges through research, collaboration, and community engagement.

The interactive nature of the webinar facilitated meaningful discussions and knowledge exchange with academic professionals from diverse institutions, offering new perspectives and best practices that the university can consider adopting. Overall, the activity successfully met its objectives, enhancing institutional awareness and capacity to contribute to innovation-led development and future improvement in global university rankings. It also strengthened the university’s commitment to aligning academic initiatives with the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs), particularly in the areas of quality education, innovation, and partnerships.

columns.title: Recommendations
content: Based on the insights gained from the WURI Webinar, it is recommended that the university establish a dedicated task force to align its existing programs and initiatives with the WURI evaluation framework, focusing on key areas such as innovation, entrepreneurial spirit, industrial application, ethical value, and social responsibility. Strengthening the documentation and reporting of innovative practices is also crucial, as this will support future ranking submissions and promote institutional visibility. In addition, enhancing partnerships with industry and community stakeholders is encouraged to foster collaborative, real-world solutions that contribute to both academic excellence and societal development. The integration of WURI criteria into the university’s strategic planning and performance assessment processes should be prioritized to ensure long-term alignment with innovation and impact-driven goals. Internal capacity-building activities, such as seminars and workshops, should be conducted to raise awareness among faculty and staff about the importance of innovation in higher education. Finally, active participation in future WURI-related events and collaborative projects is recommended to maintain engagement with global trends and best practices in university innovation and social contribution.

title: Mobile STUDY: Sustainable Training for Understanding and Defending Youth Rights Booth

content: In today’s rapidly evolving world, youth rights are at the forefront of social and political conversations, yet many young people remain unaware of their fundamental rights and the avenues available for protection and advocacy. The STUDY: Sustainable Training for Understanding and Defending Youth Rights project seeks to empower youth by equipping them with essential knowledge, skills, and resources to understand and actively defend their rights. Recognizing that informed young individuals are vital agents of change, the project fosters a culture of awareness and advocacy to ensure their voices are heard and respected in decision-making processes that impact their lives. Through engaging workshops, interactive sessions, and practical training, participants will gain the tools necessary to effectively navigate challenges related to their rights and responsibilities.

sections.title: This projects aims to:
items: Raise awareness of human and gender rights among students, faculty, and the local community through interactive and accessible learning platforms
Promote gender equality by engaging individuals in educational activities that highlight the importance of inclusive policies and behaviors
Foster advocacy for gender-sensitive environments by equipping participants with knowledge and practical tools to challenge discrimination

sections.title: Contributions to the Sustainable Development Goals
content: The STUDY project significantly advances multiple United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) by empowering youth through education, advocacy, and inclusive engagement, playing a vital role in fostering a just, equitable, and sustainable society. It supports SDG 4: Quality Education by providing accessible, inclusive learning opportunities centered on human and gender rights, enabling participants to deepen their understanding and engage actively in civic life. In promoting SDG 5: Gender Equality, the project raises awareness of gender-based issues and equips youth with skills to advocate for inclusive policies, fostering respect for all gender identities within schools and communities. Addressing SDG 10: Reduced Inequalities, STUDY reaches marginalized and underserved youth, especially those with limited access to formal education, through mobile and on-site sessions that extend rights education beyond traditional settings. The initiative also contributes to SDG 16: Peace, Justice, and Strong Institutions by enhancing youth knowledge of legal rights and protection mechanisms, empowering them to engage in democratic processes and hold institutions accountable. Lastly, in line with SDG 17: Partnerships for the Goals, the project fosters collaboration among students, educators, local leaders, and advocacy groups, ensuring sustained impact and collective action toward youth empowerment and rights protection. Through this comprehensive approach, the STUDY project not only educates but also mobilizes young people to become proactive defenders of their rights, advancing the broader agenda of sustainable development.

columns.title: General Assessment
content: The implementation of the STUDY: Sustainable Training for Understanding and Defending Youth Rights activity was highly effective in achieving its objectives of raising awareness and promoting advocacy among the youth. The interactive booth setup proved to be an engaging and impactful method for delivering essential information about human and gender rights. By incorporating educational games, the activity successfully captured students’ interest and translated complex topics into fun, relatable, and thought-provoking experiences. Participants actively engaged with the content, demonstrating curiosity, enthusiasm, and a willingness to learn and discuss relevant issues. The informal setting also encouraged greater participation, especially from those who might be less comfortable in traditional classroom environments. Feedback from students indicated an increased awareness of their rights and a better understanding of how to recognize and respond to instances of inequality or discrimination. Overall, the activity fostered a positive learning atmosphere, empowered young individuals with practical knowledge, and laid the groundwork for continued advocacy and awareness within the school community.

columns.title: Recommendations
content: To further improve the effectiveness and reach of the STUDY: Sustainable Training for Understanding and Defending Youth Rights activity, several recommendations are proposed. First, expanding the booth’s presence across multiple days or incorporating it into larger school events could allow more students to participate and engage meaningfully. It would also be beneficial to include a greater variety of interactive materials, such as digital quizzes, role-playing scenarios, or multimedia presentations, to cater to different learning styles. Partnering with student organizations or campus clubs may also help in mobilizing a wider audience and sustaining interest beyond the activity period. Additionally, providing simple educational handouts or takeaway materials would allow participants to review key concepts after the event and share them with others. To measure impact more effectively, a brief feedback or reflection form could be introduced to assess knowledge gained and areas for improvement. Lastly, follow-up sessions or workshops could help deepen participants’ understanding and provide continued support for those interested in becoming youth rights advocates within their communities.

title: Unlocking Potential: Empowering Lives through Education for Persons Deprived of Liberties

content: The “Unlocking Potential: Empowering Lives through Education for Persons Deprived of Liberties” project seeks to provide tailored educational opportunities to individuals marginalized or excluded from traditional schooling due to circumstances such as incarceration. This comprehensive program emphasizes the right of Persons Deprived of Liberties (PDLs) to education, personal growth, and successful reintegration into society. By addressing the unique challenges faced by incarcerated individuals, the initiative not only empowers PDLs through education, skill-building, and personal development but also promotes community well-being and safety. Ultimately, the project aims to transform participants’ lives, enabling them to become positive contributors to society upon release.

sections.title: This projects aims to:
items: Equip participants with essential vocational skills by achieving at least a 75% proficiency rate in basic computer literacy and cooking techniques, ensuring they can confidently perform these tasks in real-world scenarios, which will increase their employability upon release.

Enhance participants' self-awareness and self-esteem by 30% through guided discussions and activities focused on self-reflection, goal-setting exercises, and emotional intelligence training, enabling them to better understand and manage their emotions and aspirations.

Improve participants' financial literacy and communication skills, with a target of 80% of participants demonstrating an understanding of budgeting and effective communication strategies through role-playing and practical exercises, preparing them for successful interactions in both personal and professional contexts.

sections.title: Contributions to the Sustainable Development Goals
content: The "Unlocking Potential" project makes a significant contribution to multiple United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) by providing inclusive, equitable education and transformative opportunities to Persons Deprived of Liberties (PDLs). Central to SDG 4: Quality Education, the program ensures marginalized individuals access structured learning in personal development, vocational, and life skills, reducing educational disparities and fostering lifelong learning. It advances SDG 8: Decent Work and Economic Growth by equipping PDLs with practical skills like computer literacy and culinary arts, enhancing their employability and supporting sustainable reintegration into the workforce. Addressing SDG 10: Reduced Inequalities, the initiative tackles systemic disadvantages faced by PDLs, affirming their worth and striving to level the playing field through empowerment and education. Supporting SDG 16: Peace, Justice, and Strong Institutions, the project promotes rehabilitation and restorative justice, preparing participants to become responsible, constructive members of society and strengthening inclusive justice systems. Lastly, reflecting SDG 17: Partnerships for the Goals, its success hinges on collaboration among educational institutions, correctional facilities, NGOs, and local governments, demonstrating shared commitment and resource mobilization for impactful, inclusive programming. In summary, "Unlocking Potential" is a transformative effort that embodies second chances, educational justice, and inclusive growth, contributing to a fairer, empowered, and sustainable society.

columns.title: General Assessment
content: The first session of the "Unlocking Potential" program was successfully conducted, achieving its primary goal of introducing participants to the importance of personal development in their rehabilitation and reintegration journey. The structured flow of the program—from the inspirational opening to the thematic learning session and interactive peer-led discussions—fostered an environment of reflection, mutual respect, and active participation. Participants were engaged throughout the session, showing enthusiasm during group activities and openness during the peer discussions, which allowed them to share experiences and learn from one another. The hands-on activities in the afternoon further reinforced key lessons and provided a meaningful platform for self-expression and application of newly acquired insights. Overall, the session was well-received, effectively setting the tone for the rest of the program and demonstrating the participants' readiness and willingness to grow through education and empowerment.

columns.title: Recommendations
content: To further enhance the effectiveness of the program, it is recommended that future sessions include more structured reflection tools such as guided journaling or self-assessment checklists to help participants internalize their learning. Extending the time for peer-led discussions could also allow for deeper engagement and give more participants the opportunity to share their insights. Providing visual aids or simple handouts during the thematic session may improve comprehension, especially for visual learners or those with limited literacy. Additionally, incorporating small group breakouts during the hands-on activities could encourage more personalized interaction and support, especially for participants who may be hesitant to speak in larger groups. Finally, gathering participant feedback at the end of each session can help facilitators adjust the pacing and content to better suit the group’s needs moving forward. These enhancements would contribute to a more impactful and inclusive learning experience.
